EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT

This Employment Agreement (“Agreement”) is made and entered into as of June 15, 2024 (“Effective Date”), by and between:

**[Employer Name]**, a [State of Incorporation] corporation, with its principal place of business at [Employer Address] (“Employer”); and

**[Employee Name]**, residing at [Employee Address] (“Employee”).

Employer and Employee may be referred to individually as a “Party” and collectively as the “Parties.”

---

**1. POSITION AND DUTIES**

1.1 **Position**. Employer hereby employs Employee as [Job Title]. Employee shall report to [Supervisor Title] or such other person as Employer may designate.

1.2 **Duties**. Employee shall perform the duties and responsibilities customarily associated with the position and such other duties as may be assigned by Employer from time to time, consistent with Employee’s position.

1.3 **Best Efforts**. Employee agrees to devote full working time, attention, and best efforts to the business and affairs of Employer and shall not engage in any other business, profession, or occupation for compensation or otherwise without the prior written consent of Employer.

---

**2. TERM OF EMPLOYMENT**

2.1 **Initial Term**. The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for a period of two (2) years (“Initial Term”), unless terminated earlier in accordance with Section 7.

2.2 **Renewal**. Upon expiration of the Initial Term, this Agreement shall automatically renew for successive one (1) year terms (“Renewal Term(s)”) unless either Party provides written notice of non-renewal at least sixty (60) days prior to the expiration of the then-current term.

---

**3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS**

3.1 **Base Salary**. Employer shall pay Employee a base salary of $[Amount] per annum, payable in accordance with Employer’s standard payroll practices and subject to applicable withholdings and deductions.

3.2 **Bonus**. Employee shall be eligible to participate in Employer’s annual bonus program, with a target bonus of [Percentage]% of base salary, subject to the terms of the program and Employer’s discretion.

3.3 **Equity Compensation**. If applicable, Employee shall be eligible to participate in Employer’s equity incentive plan, subject to the terms and conditions of such plan and any applicable award agreements.

3.4 **Benefits**. Employee shall be eligible to participate in Employer’s benefit plans, including health, dental, vision, life insurance, and retirement plans, on the same terms as similarly situated employees, subject to plan terms and Employer policies.

3.5 **Paid Time Off**. Employee shall accrue paid time off (“PTO”) at the rate of [Number] days per year, in accordance with Employer’s PTO policy.

3.6 **Business Expenses**. Employer shall reimburse Employee for all reasonable and necessary business expenses incurred in the performance of Employee’s duties, in accordance with Employer’s expense reimbursement policy.

---

**4. CONFIDENTIALITY AND PROPRIETARY RIGHTS**

4.1 **Confidential Information**. Employee acknowledges that during employment, Employee will have access to confidential and proprietary information of Employer (“Confidential Information”). Employee agrees not to disclose, use, or permit the use of any Confidential Information except as required in the performance of Employee’s duties for Employer.

4.2 **Return of Materials**. Upon termination of employment or at Employer’s request, Employee shall promptly return all documents, materials, and property containing or reflecting Confidential Information.

4.3 **Inventions and Works**. Employee agrees that all inventions, discoveries, developments, works of authorship, and improvements conceived, developed, or made by Employee during the term of employment, whether alone or with others, that relate to Employer’s business (“Work Product”) shall be the sole property of Employer. Employee hereby assigns to Employer all right, title, and interest in and to all such Work Product.

4.4 **Non-Disclosure Obligation**. The obligations under this Section 4 shall survive the termination of this Agreement and Employee’s employment.

---

**5. NON-COMPETITION AND NON-SOLICITATION**

5.1 **Non-Competition**. During the term of employment and for a period of twelve (12) months following the termination of employment for any reason, Employee shall not, within [Geographic Area], directly or indirectly, engage in, own, manage, operate, control, or participate in the ownership, management, operation, or control of any business that is competitive with Employer’s business as conducted during the term of employment.

5.2 **Non-Solicitation of Customers**. During the term of employment and for a period of twelve (12) months following the termination of employment for any reason, Employee shall not, directly or indirectly, solicit or attempt to solicit any customer or client of Employer with whom Employee had material contact during the last twelve (12) months of employment for the purpose of providing products or services competitive with those offered by Employer.

5.3 **Non-Solicitation of Employees**. During the term of employment and for a period of twelve (12) months following the termination of employment for any reason, Employee shall not, directly or indirectly, solicit or attempt to solicit any employee or independent contractor of Employer to terminate their relationship with Employer or to become employed or engaged by any other business.

5.4 **Reasonableness**. Employee acknowledges that the restrictions in this Section 5 are reasonable and necessary to protect Employer’s legitimate business interests.

5.5 **Severability of Covenants**. If any provision of this Section 5 is found to be unenforceable, the remainder shall be enforced to the maximum extent permissible, and the scope of any unenforceable provision shall be reduced to render it enforceable.

---

**6. REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES**

6.1 **Employee Representations**. Employee represents and warrants that Employee is not a party to any agreement or subject to any restriction that would prevent Employee from entering into or performing Employee’s duties under this Agreement.

6.2 **Employer Representations**. Employer represents and warrants that it has the authority to enter into this Agreement and to employ Employee on the terms set forth herein.

---

**7. TERMINATION**

7.1 **Termination by Employer for Cause**. Employer may terminate Employee’s employment at any time for Cause (as defined below), effective immediately upon written notice to Employee. For purposes of this Agreement, “Cause” means:

  (a) Employee’s material breach of this Agreement or any written policy of Employer;
  
  (b) Employee’s willful misconduct or gross negligence in the performance of duties;
  
  (c) Employee’s conviction of, or plea of guilty or nolo contendere to, a felony or crime involving moral turpitude;
  
  (d) Employee’s fraud, dishonesty, or misappropriation with respect to Employer’s business; or
  
  (e) Employee’s continued failure to perform duties after written notice and a reasonable opportunity to cure.

7.2 **Termination by Employer Without Cause**. Employer may terminate Employee’s employment at any time without Cause upon thirty (30) days’ written notice to Employee.

7.3 **Termination by Employee for Good Reason**. Employee may terminate employment for Good Reason (as defined below) upon thirty (30) days’ written notice to Employer, provided Employer fails to cure the condition constituting Good Reason within such notice period. “Good Reason” means:

  (a) A material reduction in Employee’s base salary or benefits (other than a reduction applicable to all similarly situated employees);
  
  (b) A material diminution in Employee’s duties, authority, or responsibilities;
  
  (c) Relocation of Employee’s principal place of employment by more than fifty (50) miles without Employee’s consent.

7.4 **Termination by Employee Without Good Reason**. Employee may terminate employment at any time without Good Reason upon thirty (30) days’ written notice to Employer.

7.5 **Death or Disability**. Employee’s employment shall terminate automatically upon Employee’s death. Employer may terminate employment upon Employee’s Disability (as defined below) upon thirty (30) days’ written notice. “Disability” means Employee’s inability to perform the essential functions of the position, with or without reasonable accommodation, for a period of ninety (90) consecutive days or one hundred twenty (120) days in any twelve (12) month period.

7.6 **Obligations Upon Termination**.

  (a) Upon termination of employment for any reason, Employer shall pay Employee (i) any accrued but unpaid base salary through the date of termination, (ii) any accrued but unused PTO, and (iii) any unreimbursed business expenses incurred prior to termination, subject to Employer’s policies.
  
  (b) If Employee is terminated by Employer without Cause or resigns for Good Reason, and provided Employee executes a general release of claims in a form acceptable to Employer, Employee shall be entitled to receive severance pay equal to three (3) months of base salary, payable in accordance with Employer’s regular payroll schedule.
  
  (c) All benefits shall terminate in accordance with the terms of the applicable benefit plans, except as otherwise required by law.

7.7 **Survival**. The provisions of Sections 4, 5, 8, 9, and 10 shall survive the termination of this Agreement.

---

**8. DISPUTE RESOLUTION**

8.1 **Negotiation**. In the event of any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement or the breach thereof (“Dispute”), the Parties shall first attempt in good faith to resolve the Dispute by negotiation.

8.2 **Mediation**. If the Dispute is not resolved by negotiation within thirty (30) days, either Party may submit the Dispute to non-binding mediation administered by the American Arbitration Association (“AAA”) or another mutually agreed mediator, to be held in [City, State].

8.3 **Arbitration**. If the Dispute is not resolved by mediation within sixty (60) days after submission, the Dispute shall be finally resolved by binding arbitration administered by the AAA in accordance with its Employment Arbitration Rules. The arbitration shall be conducted in [City, State] before a single arbitrator. Judgment on the award rendered by the arbitrator may be entered in any court having jurisdiction.

8.4 **Equitable Relief**. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Employer may seek injunctive or other equitable relief in any court of competent jurisdiction to enforce Sections 4 or 5.

8.5 **Attorneys’ Fees**. Each Party shall bear its own attorneys’ fees and costs in connection with any Dispute, except as otherwise provided by law or as awarded by the arbitrator.

---

**9. MISCELLANEOUS**

9.1 **Notices**. All notices required or permitted under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed given when delivered personally, sent by certified mail (return receipt requested), or by nationally recognized overnight courier, to the addresses set forth above or such other address as either Party may designate by notice.

9.2 **Entire Agreement**. This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior agreements, understandings, and representations, whether oral or written.

9.3 **Amendment**. This Agreement may be amended only by a written instrument signed by both Parties.

9.4 **Waiver**. No waiver of any provision of this Agreement shall be effective unless in writing and signed by the Party against whom enforcement is sought. No waiver of any breach shall be deemed a waiver of any subsequent breach.

9.5 **Severability**. If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall remain in full force and effect, and the invalid or unenforceable provision shall be modified to the minimum extent necessary to make it valid and enforceable.

9.6 **Assignment**. Employee may not assign or delegate any rights or obligations under this Agreement without Employer’s prior written consent. Employer may assign this Agreement to any successor or affiliate.

9.7 **Governing Law**. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of [Governing Law State], without regard to its conflict of law principles.

9.8 **Counterparts**. This Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument. Signatures delivered by electronic means shall be deemed effective.

9.9 **Headings**. The headings in this Agreement are for convenience only and shall not affect the interpretation of this Agreement.

9.10 **Construction**. The Parties acknowledge that each has had the opportunity to review this Agreement with counsel and that this Agreement shall not be construed against either Party as the drafter.

---

**10. DEFINITIONS**

10.1 **“Cause”** has the meaning set forth in Section 7.1.

10.2 **“Good Reason”** has the meaning set forth in Section 7.3.

10.3 **“Disability”** has the meaning set forth in Section 7.5.

10.4 **“Confidential Information”** means all non-public information, whether oral, written, electronic, or otherwise, relating to Employer’s business, including but not limited to trade secrets, business plans, financial information, customer lists, and personnel information.

10.5 **“Work Product”** has the meaning set forth in Section 4.3.

---

**IN WITNESS WHEREOF**, the Parties have executed this Employment Agreement as of the Effective Date.

EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT

This Employment Agreement (the "Agreement") is made and entered into as of June 1, 2024 (the "Effective Date"), by and between:

Acme Solutions, Inc., a Delaware corporation with its principal place of business at 123 Innovation Drive, Wilmington, DE 19801 (the "Company"),

and

Jordan Lee, residing at 456 Maple Avenue, Philadelphia, PA 19103 (the "Employee").

RECITALS

WHEREAS, the Company desires to employ the Employee, and the Employee desires to accept such employment, on the terms and conditions set forth herein;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and promises contained herein, the parties agree as follows:

1. POSITION AND DUTIES

1.1 Position. The Company hereby employs the Employee as Senior Project Manager. The Employee shall report directly to the Chief Operating Officer (COO) or such other person as the Company may designate.

1.2 Duties. The Employee shall perform all duties customarily associated with the position of Senior Project Manager, including but not limited to overseeing project teams, managing client relationships, and ensuring timely delivery of project milestones. The Employee shall devote their full business time and attention to the business of the Company and shall not engage in any other business, professional, or job-related activities without the prior written consent of the Company.

1.3 Location. The Employee's principal place of employment shall be the Company's office in Wilmington, Delaware. However, the Employee may be required to travel to other locations as necessary to fulfill their duties.

2. TERM OF EMPLOYMENT

2.1 Term. The term of this Agreement shall commence on June 15, 2024 (the "Commencement Date") and shall continue for a period of three (3) years, unless earlier terminated in accordance with Section 6 of this Agreement (the "Initial Term").

2.2 Renewal. Upon expiration of the Initial Term, this Agreement shall automatically renew for successive one (1) year periods unless either party provides written notice of non-renewal at least ninety (90) days prior to the expiration of the then-current term.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS

3.1 Base Salary. The Company shall pay the Employee an annual base salary of One Hundred Twenty Thousand Dollars ($120,000), payable in accordance with the Company's standard payroll practices, but no less frequently than monthly.

3.2 Bonus. The Employee shall be eligible to receive an annual performance bonus of up to fifteen percent (15%) of the Employee's base salary, subject to the achievement of performance goals established by the Company in its sole discretion. The bonus, if any, shall be paid within sixty (60) days following the end of each calendar year.

3.3 Equity. Subject to approval by the Board of Directors, the Employee shall be granted options to purchase 5,000 shares of the Company's common stock, vesting over a four (4) year period with a one-year cliff, in accordance with the terms of the Company's 2022 Equity Incentive Plan.

3.4 Benefits. The Employee shall be eligible to participate in all employee benefit plans and programs generally made available to similarly situated employees of the Company, including health, dental, vision, and retirement plans, subject to the terms and conditions of such plans.

3.5 Paid Time Off. The Employee shall be entitled to twenty (20) days of paid time off (PTO) per calendar year, in addition to Company-recognized holidays. PTO shall accrue at a rate of 1.5 days per month of employment.

3.6 Expense Reimbursement. The Company shall reimburse the Employee for all reasonable and necessary business expenses incurred in the performance of their duties, in accordance with the Company's expense reimbursement policy.

3.7 Payroll Schedule. The Employee's salary shall be paid bi-weekly, with each pay period covering two weeks of work.

4. CONFIDENTIALITY AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY

4.1 Confidential Information. The Employee acknowledges that during the course of employment, they will have access to confidential and proprietary information of the Company ("Confidential Information"). The Employee agrees not to disclose or use any Confidential Information except as necessary to perform their duties under this Agreement.

4.2 Return of Property. Upon termination of employment, the Employee shall promptly return all Company property, including documents, devices, and materials containing Confidential Information.

4.3 Intellectual Property. The Employee agrees that all inventions, works of authorship, and developments conceived or made by the Employee during the term of employment that relate to the Company's business shall be the sole property of the Company.

5. NON-COMPETITION AND NON-SOLICITATION

5.1 Non-Competition. During the term of employment and for a period of twelve (12) months following termination for any reason, the Employee shall not, directly or indirectly, engage in any business that is competitive with the business of the Company within the United States.

5.2 Non-Solicitation. During the term of employment and for a period of eighteen (18) months following termination, the Employee shall not solicit or attempt to solicit any employee, consultant, or customer of the Company to terminate their relationship with the Company.

6. TERMINATION

6.1 Termination by the Company. The Company may terminate the Employee's employment at any time for Cause (as defined below) or without Cause upon thirty (30) days' written notice.

6.2 Termination by the Employee. The Employee may terminate their employment at any time upon sixty (60) days' written notice to the Company.

6.3 Definition of Cause. For purposes of this Agreement, "Cause" shall mean (a) material breach of this Agreement by the Employee; (b) conviction of a felony or crime involving moral turpitude; (c) gross negligence or willful misconduct in the performance of duties; or (d) fraud or dishonesty.

6.4 Severance. In the event the Company terminates the Employee's employment without Cause, the Employee shall be entitled to receive severance pay equal to three (3) months of base salary, payable in a lump sum within thirty (30) days following the date of termination, provided the Employee executes a general release of claims in a form satisfactory to the Company.

6.5 Accrued Obligations. Upon termination of employment for any reason, the Employee shall be entitled to receive (a) any accrued but unpaid base salary through the date of termination, (b) any accrued but unused PTO, and (c) reimbursement for any unreimbursed business expenses incurred prior to the date of termination.

7. REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES

7.1 By the Employee. The Employee represents and warrants that they are not subject to any agreement or restriction that would prevent them from entering into or performing their obligations under this Agreement.

7.2 By the Company. The Company represents and warrants that it has the authority to enter into this Agreement and to employ the Employee on the terms set forth herein.

8. MISCELLANEOUS

8.1 Governing Law. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware, without regard to its conflict of law principles.

8.2 Dispute Resolution. Any dispute arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall be resolved exclusively in the state or federal courts located in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, and each party hereby consents to the jurisdiction of such courts.

8.3 Entire Agreement. This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior agreements, understandings, and representations, whether written or oral.

8.4 Amendment. This Agreement may be amended only by a written instrument signed by both parties.

8.5 Severability. If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall continue in full force and effect.

8.6 Assignment. The Employee may not assign any of their rights or obligations under this Agreement without the prior written consent of the Company. The Company may assign this Agreement to any successor or affiliate.

8.7 Notices. All notices required or permitted under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed given when delivered personally, sent by certified mail, or by recognized overnight courier to the addresses set forth above or to such other address as either party may designate in writing.

8.8 Counterparts. This Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Employment Agreement as of the Effective Date.

ACME SOLUTIONS, INC.

known_contradictions: Conflicting Dates: Section 2.1 states that the term of the Agreement commences on June 15, 2024 (the 'Commencement Date'), but the preamble and signature block state the Agreement is made and effective as of June 1, 2024 (the 'Effective Date'). This creates ambiguity as to when employment actually begins.

Inconsistent Payment Schedule: Section 3.1 states that salary is payable 'no less frequently than monthly,' but Section 3.7 states that salary is paid bi-weekly. This creates confusion as to the actual payroll schedule.

Contradictory Governing Law and Jurisdiction: Section 8.1 states that the Agreement is governed by Delaware law, but Section 8.2 requires disputes to be resolved exclusively in courts located in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. This creates a conflict between the governing law and the forum for dispute resolution.

Mismatched Definition vs Usage: In Section 5.1, the non-competition obligation is limited to the United States, but Section 1.2 requires the Employee to devote 'full business time and attention' to the Company and not engage in any other business without consent, with no geographic limitation. This creates ambiguity regarding the scope of permissible outside activities, especially if the Employee were to engage in non-competitive business outside the United States.

SERVICE AGREEMENT

This Service Agreement (“Agreement”) is entered into as of June 15, 2024 (“Effective Date”), by and between:

**Service Provider:**  
[Provider Name], a [State/Country of Incorporation] [corporation/LLC/sole proprietorship], with its principal place of business at [Provider Address] (“Provider”);

and

**Client:**  
[Client Name], a [State/Country of Incorporation] [corporation/LLC/individual], with its principal place of business at [Client Address] (“Client”).

Provider and Client may be referred to individually as a “Party” and collectively as the “Parties.”

---

**1. DEFINITIONS**

1.1. “Services” means the professional services described in Exhibit A attached hereto and incorporated herein by reference.

1.2. “Deliverables” means all materials, reports, documents, software, or other items to be delivered by Provider to Client as specified in Exhibit A.

1.3. “Confidential Information” means any non-public information disclosed by one Party to the other, whether oral, written, electronic, or in any other form, that is designated as confidential or that reasonably should be understood to be confidential.

1.4. “Term” means the duration of this Agreement as set forth in Section 7.

---

**2. SCOPE OF SERVICES**

2.1. Provider shall perform the Services and deliver the Deliverables in accordance with the specifications, timelines, and milestones set forth in Exhibit A.

2.2. Any changes to the scope of Services or Deliverables must be agreed upon in writing by both Parties through a Change Order, which shall be attached as an amendment to this Agreement.

2.3. Provider shall use commercially reasonable efforts, skill, and diligence in performing the Services and delivering the Deliverables.

2.4. Provider shall assign qualified personnel to perform the Services. Provider may not subcontract any portion of the Services without Client’s prior written consent, which shall not be unreasonably withheld.

---

**3. FEES, EXPENSES, AND PAYMENT TERMS**

3.1. **Fees.** Client shall pay Provider the fees set forth in Exhibit B (“Fees”).

3.2. **Expenses.** Client shall reimburse Provider for pre-approved, reasonable, and necessary out-of-pocket expenses incurred in connection with the performance of the Services, as detailed in Exhibit B.

3.3. **Invoices.** Provider shall submit invoices to Client on a monthly basis, or as otherwise specified in Exhibit B. Each invoice shall itemize the Services performed, Deliverables provided, and any reimbursable expenses.

3.4. **Payment Terms.** Client shall pay all undisputed amounts within thirty (30) days of receipt of each invoice. Any disputed amounts must be identified in writing within ten (10) days of receipt of the invoice, and the Parties shall work in good faith to resolve such disputes in accordance with Section 13.

3.5. **Late Payments.** Any undisputed payment not received within thirty (30) days of the invoice date shall accrue interest at the rate of 1.5% per month or the maximum rate permitted by law, whichever is less, until paid in full.

---

**4. CLIENT OBLIGATIONS**

4.1. Client shall provide Provider with timely access to all information, materials, personnel, and facilities reasonably required by Provider to perform the Services.

4.2. Client shall designate a primary contact person to facilitate communication and decision-making.

4.3. Client shall review and provide feedback on Deliverables within five (5) business days of receipt. If Client fails to provide feedback within such period, the Deliverable shall be deemed accepted.

4.4. Client shall not require Provider to perform any act or omission that would violate applicable law or regulation.

---

**5. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY**

5.1. **Ownership of Deliverables.** Upon full payment of all Fees and expenses due under this Agreement, Provider hereby assigns to Client all right, title, and interest in and to the Deliverables, except for any Provider Materials as defined in Section 5.2.

5.2. **Provider Materials.** Provider retains all right, title, and interest in and to any pre-existing materials, tools, software, methodologies, or intellectual property owned or developed by Provider prior to or outside the scope of this Agreement (“Provider Materials”). To the extent any Provider Materials are incorporated into the Deliverables, Provider grants Client a non-exclusive, perpetual, royalty-free license to use such Provider Materials solely as part of the Deliverables.

5.3. **Third-Party Materials.** If the Deliverables include any third-party materials, Provider shall identify such materials in writing and obtain for Client, at Client’s expense and prior written approval, the necessary licenses to use such materials.

5.4. **Moral Rights.** Provider waives all moral rights in the Deliverables to the extent permitted by law.

---

**6. CONFIDENTIALITY**

6.1. Each Party agrees to maintain the confidentiality of the other Party’s Confidential Information and to use such Confidential Information solely for the purposes of performing its obligations under this Agreement.

6.2. Confidential Information shall not include information that: (a) is or becomes publicly available through no fault of the receiving Party; (b) is lawfully received from a third party without restriction; (c) is independently developed by the receiving Party without use of or reference to the disclosing Party’s Confidential Information; or (d) is required to be disclosed by law or court order, provided that the receiving Party gives prompt written notice to the disclosing Party and cooperates in seeking a protective order.

6.3. Upon termination or expiration of this Agreement, each Party shall promptly return or destroy all Confidential Information of the other Party, except as required to comply with applicable law or for archival purposes.

6.4. The obligations of confidentiality in this Section 6 shall survive for five (5) years following the termination or expiration of this Agreement.

---

**7. TERM AND TERMINATION**

7.1. **Term.** This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and continue for twelve (12) months, unless earlier terminated in accordance with this Section 7 (“Initial Term”). The Agreement may be renewed for additional twelve (12) month periods upon mutual written agreement of the Parties.

7.2. **Termination for Convenience.** Either Party may terminate this Agreement for any reason upon thirty (30) days’ prior written notice to the other Party.

7.3. **Termination for Cause.** Either Party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice if the other Party: (a) materially breaches any provision of this Agreement and fails to cure such breach within fifteen (15) days after receipt of written notice; or (b) becomes insolvent, files for bankruptcy, or has a receiver appointed.

7.4. **Effect of Termination.** Upon termination, Provider shall cease all Services, deliver to Client all completed and in-progress Deliverables, and submit a final invoice for Services performed and expenses incurred through the date of termination. Client shall pay Provider for all Services performed and expenses incurred up to the effective date of termination.

7.5. **Survival.** Sections 5 (Intellectual Property), 6 (Confidentiality), 8 (Warranties), 9 (Indemnification), 10 (Limitation of Liability), 12 (Governing Law), and 13 (Dispute Resolution) shall survive termination or expiration of this Agreement.

---

**8. WARRANTIES**

8.1. **Provider Warranties.** Provider represents and warrants that:

(a) The Services will be performed in a professional and workmanlike manner in accordance with industry standards;

(b) The Deliverables will conform in all material respects to the specifications set forth in Exhibit A for a period of ninety (90) days following delivery;

(c) Provider has the right and authority to enter into this Agreement and to grant the rights and licenses set forth herein;

(d) The Deliverables, excluding any Client-provided or third-party materials, will not infringe any intellectual property rights of any third party.

8.2. **Client Warranties.** Client represents and warrants that:

(a) Client has the right and authority to enter into this Agreement and to provide any materials or information necessary for Provider to perform the Services;

(b) Any materials provided by Client to Provider do not infringe the intellectual property rights of any third party.

8.3. **Disclaimer.** EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY PROVIDED IN THIS AGREEMENT, NEITHER PARTY MAKES ANY OTHER WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION ANY IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

---

**9. INDEMNIFICATION**

9.1. **By Provider.** Provider shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Client and its officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys’ fees) arising out of or relating to: (a) any breach by Provider of its representations, warranties, or obligations under this Agreement; or (b) any claim that the Deliverables, excluding any Client-provided or third-party materials, infringe any intellectual property rights of a third party.

9.2. **By Client.** Client shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Provider and its officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys’ fees) arising out of or relating to: (a) any breach by Client of its representations, warranties, or obligations under this Agreement; or (b) any claim that any materials provided by Client infringe any intellectual property rights of a third party.

9.3. **Indemnification Procedure.** The indemnified Party shall promptly notify the indemnifying Party in writing of any claim for which indemnification is sought. The indemnifying Party shall have sole control of the defense and settlement of such claim, provided that the indemnified Party may participate in the defense at its own expense. The indemnifying Party shall not settle any claim without the indemnified Party’s prior written consent, which shall not be unreasonably withheld.

---

**10. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY**

10.1. EXCEPT FOR LIABILITY ARISING FROM A PARTY’S GROSS NEGLIGENCE, WILLFUL MISCONDUCT, BREACH OF CONFIDENTIALITY, OR INDEMNIFICATION OBLIGATIONS UNDER SECTION 9, IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES, INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION LOSS OF PROFITS, REVENUE, OR DATA, WHETHER IN AN ACTION IN CONTRACT, TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE), OR OTHERWISE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.

10.2. EXCEPT FOR LIABILITY ARISING FROM A PARTY’S GROSS NEGLIGENCE, WILLFUL MISCONDUCT, BREACH OF CONFIDENTIALITY, OR INDEMNIFICATION OBLIGATIONS UNDER SECTION 9, THE AGGREGATE LIABILITY OF EITHER PARTY UNDER THIS AGREEMENT SHALL NOT EXCEED THE TOTAL FEES PAID OR PAYABLE BY CLIENT TO PROVIDER UNDER THIS AGREEMENT IN THE TWELVE (12) MONTHS PRECEDING THE EVENT GIVING RISE TO THE CLAIM.

---

**11. INSURANCE**

11.1. Provider shall maintain, at its own expense, during the Term of this Agreement, the following insurance coverage:

(a) Commercial General Liability Insurance with limits of not less than $1,000,000 per occurrence and $2,000,000 aggregate;

(b) Professional Liability (Errors & Omissions) Insurance with limits of not less than $1,000,000 per claim and $2,000,000 aggregate;

(c) Workers’ Compensation Insurance as required by applicable law.

11.2. Upon request, Provider shall furnish Client with certificates of insurance evidencing the required coverage.

---

**12. GOVERNING LAW**

12.1. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of [Governing Law State], without regard to its conflict of law principles.

---

13.1. **Negotiation.** In the event of any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, the Parties shall first attempt in good faith to resolve the dispute through negotiation between senior executives of each Party.

---

text:
**RESIDENTIAL RENTAL AGREEMENT**

This Residential Rental Agreement (“Agreement”) is made and entered into as of the ___ day of ____________, 20__, by and between:

**Landlord:**  
Name: __________________________________________  
Address: _______________________________________  
Phone: _________________________________________  
Email: _________________________________________  

**Tenant:**  
Name(s): _______________________________________  
Address: _______________________________________  
Phone: _________________________________________  
Email: _________________________________________  

**Premises:**  
Address: ____________________________________________________________  
Unit/Apt #: _______________  
City: ____________________ State: _______ Zip: ___________  

**1. TERM OF LEASE**  
1.1 **Initial Term:** The term of this Agreement shall commence on the ___ day of ____________, 20__ (“Commencement Date”) and shall:  
☐ Continue on a month-to-month basis.  
☐ Continue for a fixed period ending on the ___ day of ____________, 20__ (“Expiration Date”).  

1.2 **Renewal:** If neither party provides written notice of non-renewal at least thirty (30) days prior to the Expiration Date, this Agreement shall automatically convert to a month-to-month tenancy under the same terms and conditions.

**2. RENT**  
2.1 **Amount:** Tenant shall pay to Landlord as rent for the Premises the sum of $__________ per month (“Rent”).  

2.2 **Due Date:** Rent is due in advance on the first (1st) day of each month.  

2.3 **Method of Payment:** Rent shall be paid by:  
☐ Check  
☐ Money Order  
☐ Electronic Transfer  
☐ Other: ___________________________  
Payments shall be made to:  
Name: __________________________________________  
Address: _______________________________________  
or as otherwise directed in writing by Landlord.  

2.4 **Late Payment:** If Rent is not received by the fifth (5th) day after the due date, Tenant shall pay a late fee of $__________ or ___% of the monthly Rent, whichever is greater.  

2.5 **Returned Payments:** Tenant shall pay a fee of $__________ for any returned or dishonored payment.

**3. SECURITY DEPOSIT**  
3.1 **Amount:** Tenant shall deposit with Landlord the sum of $__________ (“Security Deposit”) upon execution of this Agreement.  

3.2 **Purpose:** The Security Deposit secures Tenant’s obligations under this Agreement, including but not limited to unpaid Rent, damages beyond normal wear and tear, and costs of cleaning.  

3.3 **Return:** Within thirty (30) days after Tenant vacates the Premises and returns all keys, Landlord shall return the Security Deposit, less any lawful deductions, with an itemized statement of deductions.  

3.4 **No Interest:** Unless required by law, the Security Deposit shall not accrue interest.

**4. OCCUPANTS**  
4.1 The Premises shall be occupied only by the Tenant(s) listed above and the following individuals:  
Name(s): ____________________________________________________________  
No other persons may reside at the Premises without Landlord’s prior written consent.

**5. USE OF PREMISES**  
5.1 The Premises shall be used solely for residential purposes and not for any commercial, business, or unlawful purposes.  

5.2 Tenant shall not engage in or permit any illegal activity on or about the Premises.

**6. UTILITIES AND SERVICES**  
6.1 **Landlord’s Responsibility:** Landlord shall be responsible for payment of the following utilities and services:  
☐ Water  
☐ Sewer  
☐ Trash Collection  
☐ Gas  
☐ Electricity  
☐ Internet  
☐ Other: ___________________________  

6.2 **Tenant’s Responsibility:** Tenant shall be responsible for payment of all other utilities and services not listed above, including but not limited to:  
☐ Gas  
☐ Electricity  
☐ Cable/Satellite  
☐ Internet  
☐ Telephone  
☐ Other: ___________________________  

6.3 If any utility is separately metered, Tenant shall establish accounts in Tenant’s name prior to occupancy.

**7. MAINTENANCE AND REPAIRS**  
7.1 **Landlord’s Obligations:** Landlord shall maintain the Premises in a habitable condition and comply with all applicable building, housing, and health codes. Landlord shall be responsible for repairs not caused by Tenant’s negligence or misuse.  

7.2 **Tenant’s Obligations:** Tenant shall:  
(a) Keep the Premises clean and sanitary;  
(b) Promptly notify Landlord of any damage, defect, or needed repair;  
(c) Not deliberately or negligently destroy, deface, damage, or remove any part of the Premises;  
(d) Be responsible for damages caused by Tenant, occupants, or guests, beyond normal wear and tear.  

7.3 **Alterations:** Tenant shall not make any alterations, additions, or improvements to the Premises without Landlord’s prior written consent. Any approved alterations shall become the property of Landlord unless otherwise agreed in writing.

**8. ENTRY**  
8.1 Landlord may enter the Premises for inspection, repairs, maintenance, or to show the Premises to prospective tenants or buyers, upon at least twenty-four (24) hours’ prior notice, except in cases of emergency.  

8.2 In emergencies, Landlord may enter the Premises without prior notice.

**9. RULES AND REGULATIONS**  
9.1 Tenant shall comply with all rules and regulations attached as Exhibit A, and any reasonable modifications thereof, provided Landlord gives Tenant written notice of such modifications.

**10. PETS**  
10.1 ☐ Pets are NOT permitted.  
10.2 ☐ Pets are permitted, subject to the following restrictions:  
Type/Breed: ___________________________  
Weight Limit: ______ lbs  
Number: ______  
Additional Deposit: $__________  
Tenant shall be responsible for all damages caused by pets.

**11. SMOKING**  
11.1 ☐ Smoking is NOT permitted anywhere on the Premises.  
11.2 ☐ Smoking is permitted only in the following areas: ___________________________

**12. ASSIGNMENT AND SUBLETTING**  
12.1 Tenant shall not assign this Agreement or sublet any part of the Premises without Landlord’s prior written consent, which shall not be unreasonably withheld.

**13. INSURANCE**  
13.1 Landlord’s insurance does not cover Tenant’s personal property. Tenant is strongly encouraged to obtain renter’s insurance.

**14. DAMAGE OR DESTRUCTION**  
14.1 If the Premises are rendered uninhabitable by fire, flood, or other casualty not caused by Tenant, Rent shall abate from the date of such event until the Premises are restored. If restoration is not completed within thirty (30) days, either party may terminate this Agreement by written notice.

**15. DEFAULT AND REMEDIES**  
15.1 **Default by Tenant:** The following constitute defaults by Tenant:  
(a) Failure to pay Rent or other charges when due;  
(b) Violation of any term of this Agreement;  
(c) Abandonment of the Premises;  
(d) Providing false information in connection with this Agreement.  

15.2 **Landlord’s Remedies:** Upon default, Landlord may:  
(a) Provide written notice of default and, if not cured within the time required by law, terminate this Agreement;  
(b) Pursue all remedies available at law or in equity, including eviction and recovery of damages;  
(c) Retain all or part of the Security Deposit as permitted by law.  

15.3 **Default by Landlord:** If Landlord fails to perform any obligation under this Agreement, Tenant may provide written notice specifying the default. If Landlord does not cure the default within a reasonable time, Tenant may pursue all remedies available at law.

**16. NOTICE**  
16.1 All notices required under this Agreement shall be in writing and delivered personally, by certified mail, or by email (if an email address is provided above), to the addresses listed at the beginning of this Agreement or as otherwise designated in writing.

**17. TERMINATION**  
17.1 **Notice of Termination:** Either party may terminate a month-to-month tenancy by giving at least thirty (30) days’ written notice prior to the intended termination date.  

17.2 **Surrender:** Upon termination, Tenant shall vacate the Premises, remove all personal property, return all keys, and leave the Premises in clean condition, reasonable wear and tear excepted.

**18. HOLDOVER**  
18.1 If Tenant remains in possession after the termination of this Agreement without Landlord’s consent, Tenant shall be liable for double the monthly Rent, prorated daily, and for any damages incurred by Landlord.

**19. ABANDONMENT**  
19.1 If Tenant abandons the Premises, Landlord may retake possession and dispose of Tenant’s property as permitted by law.

**20. DISPUTE RESOLUTION**  
20.1 **Negotiation:** In the event of any dispute arising out of or relating to this Agreement, the parties shall first attempt in good faith to resolve the dispute through informal negotiations.  

20.2 **Mediation:** If the dispute is not resolved within fifteen (15) days of written notice of the dispute, the parties agree to submit the dispute to mediation before a mutually agreed mediator.  

20.3 **Arbitration:** If mediation fails, the dispute shall be resolved by binding arbitration in accordance with the rules of the American Arbitration Association. The decision of the arbitrator shall be final and binding. Judgment on the award may be entered in any court of competent jurisdiction.  

20.4 **Exclusions:** Notwithstanding the foregoing, Landlord may pursue eviction proceedings or seek injunctive relief in court without first engaging in negotiation, mediation, or arbitration.

**21. ATTORNEYS’ FEES**  
21.1 In any action or proceeding arising out of this Agreement, the prevailing party shall be entitled to recover reasonable attorneys’ fees and costs.

**22. GOVERNING LAW**  
22.1 This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of _______________.

**23. SEVERABILITY**  
23.1 If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall remain in full force and effect.

**24. WAIVER**  
24.1 The failure of either party to enforce any provision of this Agreement shall not be deemed a waiver of that provision or any other provision.

**25. ENTIRE AGREEMENT**  
25.1 This Agreement, including any attached exhibits or addenda, constitutes the entire agreement between the parties and supersedes all prior agreements, representations, or understandings. No modification shall be valid unless in writing and signed by both parties.

**26. ADDITIONAL TERMS**  
26.1 The following additional terms and conditions apply:  
____________________________________________________________________________  
____________________________________________________________________________  
____________________________________________________________________________  

**27. SIGNATURES**  
IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Agreement as of the date first written above.

_____________________________  
Landlord Signature  
Date: _______________________

_____________________________  
Tenant Signature  
Date: _______________________

_____________________________  
Tenant Signature (if applicable)  
Date: _______________________

---

**EXHIBIT A: RULES AND REGULATIONS**

1. **Noise:** Tenant shall not make or permit any loud or disturbing noises that interfere with the rights, comfort, or convenience of other tenants or neighbors.
2. **Common Areas:** Tenant shall keep all common areas clean and free of personal property.
3. **Parking:** Tenant shall park only in designated areas and shall not block driveways or access ways.
4. **Garbage:** Tenant shall dispose of all garbage and waste in designated receptacles.
5. **Prohibited Items:** No hazardous materials, explosives, or flammable substances may be stored on the Premises.
6. **Alterations:** No satellite dishes, antennas, or signs may be installed without Landlord’s written consent.
7. **Keys:** Tenant shall not duplicate keys or change locks without Landlord’s written consent.
8. **Guests:** Overnight guests are permitted for up to fourteen (14) consecutive days in any six (6) month period without Landlord’s written consent.
9. **Compliance:** Tenant shall comply with all applicable laws, ordinances, and homeowners’ association rules (if any).

---

**EXHIBIT B: MOVE-IN CONDITION REPORT**  
(To be completed at move-in and attached to this Agreement.)

---

**EXHIBIT C: LEAD-BASED PAINT DISCLOSURE**  
(Required for properties built before 1978.)

RESIDENTIAL RENTAL AGREEMENT

This Residential Rental Agreement (the "Agreement") is made and entered into as of June 1, 2024 (the "Effective Date"), by and between:

Landlord: Sarah L. Thompson
Address: 1123 Maple Avenue, Springfield, State of Franklin, 12345

and

Tenant: Michael J. Carter
Address: 45 Oak Street, Springfield, State of Franklin, 12345

RECITALS
WHEREAS, Landlord is the lawful owner of the premises located at 789 Pine Street, Springfield, State of Franklin, 12345 (the "Premises"); and
WHEREAS, Tenant desires to lease the Premises from Landlord, and Landlord agrees to lease the Premises to Tenant under the terms and conditions set forth herein.

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and promises herein contained, the parties agree as follows:

1. LEASED PREMISES
1.1. The Landlord hereby leases to the Tenant, and the Tenant hereby leases from the Landlord, the Premises described above, including all improvements, fixtures, and appurtenances thereto, for residential purposes only.

2. TERM
2.1. The term of this Agreement (the "Term") shall commence on July 1, 2024 (the "Commencement Date") and shall continue for a period of twelve (12) months, expiring on June 30, 2025 (the "Expiration Date"), unless sooner terminated as provided herein.
2.2. Notwithstanding Section 2.1, the Tenant may, with thirty (30) days written notice, terminate this Agreement at any time after the first six (6) months of occupancy.
2.3. If the Tenant remains in possession of the Premises after the Expiration Date without the Landlord’s written consent, such holding over shall be deemed a month-to-month tenancy, subject to all terms and conditions herein, except that rent shall increase by 10%.

3. RENT
3.1. The Tenant agrees to pay to the Landlord as rent for the Premises the sum of One Thousand Four Hundred Dollars ($1,400.00) per month (the "Rent"), payable in advance on the first (1st) day of each calendar month during the Term.
3.2. The first month’s Rent shall be prorated if the Commencement Date is not the first day of the month.
3.3. Rent shall be paid by check, money order, or electronic transfer to the Landlord at the address specified above, or at such other place as the Landlord may designate in writing.
3.4. If Rent is not received by the fifth (5th) day of the month, a late fee of Fifty Dollars ($50.00) shall be assessed.
3.5. Notwithstanding Section 3.1, the monthly Rent for the Premises shall be One Thousand Five Hundred Dollars ($1,500.00) for the first six (6) months of the Term, after which it shall revert to One Thousand Four Hundred Dollars ($1,400.00) per month for the remainder of the Term.

4. SECURITY DEPOSIT
4.1. Upon execution of this Agreement, Tenant shall deposit with Landlord the sum of One Thousand Four Hundred Dollars ($1,400.00) as a security deposit (the "Security Deposit") to secure Tenant’s faithful performance of the terms of this Agreement.
4.2. The Security Deposit shall be held in a separate, interest-bearing account, and any interest accrued shall be payable to the Tenant annually.
4.3. The Security Deposit shall not be deemed an advance payment of Rent or a measure of Landlord’s damages in case of default by Tenant.
4.4. Within thirty (30) days after the termination of this Agreement and surrender of the Premises, Landlord shall return the Security Deposit to Tenant, less any deductions for damages, unpaid Rent, or other charges due under this Agreement.

5. USE OF PREMISES
5.1. The Premises shall be used and occupied solely by Tenant and Tenant’s immediate family, consisting of no more than four (4) persons, for residential purposes only.
5.2. No pets shall be kept on the Premises without the prior written consent of the Landlord, except for one (1) domesticated cat.
5.3. Tenant shall not use the Premises for any unlawful purpose or in any manner that would constitute a nuisance or violate any applicable law or ordinance.

6. UTILITIES AND SERVICES
6.1. Tenant shall be responsible for payment of all utilities and services supplied to the Premises, including but not limited to electricity, gas, water, sewer, trash collection, cable, and internet.
6.2. Landlord shall be responsible for payment of water and sewer charges for the Premises.
6.3. Tenant shall arrange for and pay for all utilities and services not expressly provided by Landlord.

7. MAINTENANCE AND REPAIRS
7.1. Tenant shall, at Tenant’s sole expense, keep and maintain the Premises and appurtenances in clean, sanitary, and good condition, including all appliances, fixtures, and equipment.
7.2. Landlord shall be responsible for repairs to the structural components of the Premises, including the roof, foundation, and exterior walls, except where such repairs are necessitated by the negligence or misuse of Tenant.
7.3. Tenant shall promptly notify Landlord of any damage, defect, or need for repair in or to the Premises.
7.4. Notwithstanding Section 7.2, Tenant shall be responsible for all repairs to the roof, foundation, and exterior walls, regardless of cause.

8. ALTERATIONS
8.1. Tenant shall not make any alterations, additions, or improvements to the Premises without the prior written consent of Landlord.
8.2. Any alterations, additions, or improvements made by Tenant shall become the property of Landlord upon termination of this Agreement, unless otherwise agreed in writing.

9. ENTRY AND INSPECTION
9.1. Landlord or Landlord’s agents may enter the Premises at reasonable times and upon twenty-four (24) hours’ notice to Tenant for the purpose of inspection, repairs, or showing the Premises to prospective tenants or purchasers.
9.2. In the event of an emergency, Landlord may enter the Premises without notice.

10. ASSIGNMENT AND SUBLETTING
10.1. Tenant shall not assign this Agreement or sublet any portion of the Premises without the prior written consent of Landlord, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld.

11. INSURANCE
11.1. Tenant shall obtain and maintain renter’s insurance with a minimum liability coverage of $100,000 during the Term of this Agreement and provide proof of such insurance to Landlord upon request.
11.2. Landlord shall maintain insurance on the Premises against fire and other hazards.

12. DAMAGE OR DESTRUCTION
12.1. If the Premises are rendered uninhabitable by fire, flood, or other casualty not caused by Tenant, either party may terminate this Agreement by written notice to the other.
12.2. If the Premises are partially damaged but still habitable, Rent shall be abated in proportion to the extent of the damage until repairs are completed.

13. DEFAULT
13.1. If Tenant fails to pay Rent or any other sum due under this Agreement within five (5) days after written notice from Landlord, or otherwise breaches any term of this Agreement, Landlord may terminate this Agreement and recover possession of the Premises in accordance with applicable law.
13.2. If Landlord breaches any term of this Agreement, Tenant may terminate this Agreement upon thirty (30) days’ written notice to Landlord.

14. NOTICES
14.1. Any notice required or permitted under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed given when delivered personally, sent by certified mail, or sent by email to the addresses set forth above or such other address as either party may designate in writing.

15. GOVERNING LAW
15.1. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Franklin.
15.2. Notwithstanding Section 15.1, any dispute arising under this Agreement shall be exclusively governed by the laws of the State of Columbia, without regard to its conflict of law principles.

16. ENTIRE AGREEMENT
16.1. This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties and supersedes all prior agreements, understandings, and representations.
16.2. No amendment or modification of this Agreement shall be valid unless in writing and signed by both parties.

17. SEVERABILITY
17.1. If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall remain in full force and effect.

18. WAIVER
18.1. The failure of either party to enforce any provision of this Agreement shall not be deemed a waiver of future enforcement of that or any other provision.

19. BINDING EFFECT
19.1. This Agreement shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the parties hereto and their respective heirs, legal representatives, successors, and assigns.

20. ADDITIONAL TERMS
20.1. Tenant shall not keep or store any hazardous materials on the Premises.
20.2. Landlord shall provide Tenant with two (2) sets of keys to the Premises upon commencement of the Term.
20.3. Tenant shall be responsible for snow removal from all walkways and driveways.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Agreement as of the Effective Date.

______________________________
Sarah L. Thompson, Landlord

______________________________
Michael J. Carter, Tenant
known_contradictions: Conflicting Rent Amounts: Section 3.1 states the monthly rent is $1,400.00, but Section 3.5 states that the rent is $1,500.00 for the first six months, then $1,400.00 thereafter. This creates ambiguity about the actual rent due for the first six months.

Contradictory Utility Responsibilities: Section 6.1 states Tenant is responsible for all utilities, including water and sewer, but Section 6.2 states Landlord is responsible for water and sewer charges. This creates a conflict regarding who pays for water and sewer.

Contradictory Repair Obligations: Section 7.2 states Landlord is responsible for repairs to structural components (roof, foundation, exterior walls), except if caused by Tenant’s negligence, but Section 7.4 states Tenant is responsible for all repairs to the roof, foundation, and exterior walls regardless of cause. This creates a direct conflict over who is responsible for major repairs.

Conflicting Governing Law Clauses: Section 15.1 states the Agreement is governed by the laws of the State of Franklin, but Section 15.2 states that any dispute is governed by the laws of the State of Columbia. This creates a substantive legal contradiction regarding jurisdiction.
