**PURCHASE AGREEMENT**

**This Purchase Agreement** (“Agreement”) is made and entered into as of June 15, 2024 (“Effective Date”), by and between:

**Seller:**  
[Seller Name], a [State of Incorporation/Formation] [corporation/LLC/individual], with principal place of business at [Seller Address] (“Seller”),

and

**Buyer:**  
[Buyer Name], a [State of Incorporation/Formation] [corporation/LLC/individual], with principal place of business at [Buyer Address] (“Buyer”).

Seller and Buyer may be referred to individually as a “Party” and collectively as the “Parties.”

---

### 1. DEFINITIONS

1.1 **“Goods”** means the products, materials, or items described in Exhibit A attached hereto and incorporated herein by reference.

1.2 **“Purchase Price”** means the total amount payable by Buyer to Seller for the Goods, as set forth in Section 3 and detailed in Exhibit B.

1.3 **“Delivery Date”** means the date by which Seller must deliver the Goods to Buyer, as specified in Section 4.1.

1.4 **“Business Day”** means any day other than a Saturday, Sunday, or federal holiday in the United States.

1.5 **“Force Majeure Event”** has the meaning set forth in Section 13.

---

### 2. SALE OF GOODS

2.1 **Agreement to Sell and Purchase.** Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Seller agrees to sell, transfer, and deliver to Buyer, and Buyer agrees to purchase from Seller, the Goods described in Exhibit A.

2.2 **Quantity and Quality.** The quantity and quality of the Goods shall conform in all respects to the specifications set forth in Exhibit A.

---

### 3. PURCHASE PRICE AND PAYMENT TERMS

3.1 **Purchase Price.** The Purchase Price for the Goods shall be as set forth in Exhibit B.

3.2 **Payment Terms.** Buyer shall pay the Purchase Price to Seller as follows:

  (a) **Deposit:** Buyer shall pay a deposit of [Deposit Amount or Percentage] within five (5) Business Days of the Effective Date.

  (b) **Balance:** The remaining balance shall be paid in full no later than ten (10) Business Days prior to the Delivery Date.

3.3 **Method of Payment.** All payments shall be made by wire transfer, certified check, or other mutually agreed-upon method to the account designated by Seller in writing.

3.4 **Late Payment.** Any payment not received by the due date shall accrue interest at a rate of 1.5% per month or the maximum rate permitted by law, whichever is less, until paid in full.

---

### 4. DELIVERY AND ACCEPTANCE

4.1 **Delivery Date and Location.** Seller shall deliver the Goods to Buyer on or before [Delivery Date], at [Delivery Location], unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Parties.

4.2 **Risk of Loss.** Title to and risk of loss of the Goods shall pass to Buyer upon delivery of the Goods at the Delivery Location.

4.3 **Inspection and Acceptance.** Buyer shall have five (5) Business Days after delivery (“Inspection Period”) to inspect the Goods for conformity to the specifications in Exhibit A. If Buyer determines that any Goods do not conform, Buyer shall notify Seller in writing within the Inspection Period, specifying the nonconformity in reasonable detail.

4.4 **Acceptance.** If Buyer does not provide written notice of nonconformity within the Inspection Period, the Goods shall be deemed accepted. If Buyer timely notifies Seller of nonconformity, Seller shall, at its sole cost and expense, promptly repair or replace the nonconforming Goods.

---

### 5. REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES

5.1 **Seller’s Representations and Warranties.** Seller represents and warrants that:

  (a) Seller has good and marketable title to the Goods, free and clear of all liens, claims, and encumbrances;

  (b) The Goods conform to the specifications set forth in Exhibit A and are free from defects in material and workmanship for a period of twelve (12) months from the Delivery Date;

  (c) Seller has the right and authority to enter into this Agreement and perform its obligations hereunder.

5.2 **Buyer’s Representations and Warranties.** Buyer represents and warrants that:

  (a) Buyer has the right and authority to enter into this Agreement and perform its obligations hereunder;

  (b) Buyer has sufficient funds to pay the Purchase Price in accordance with Section 3.

5.3 **Disclaimer of Other Warranties.** EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY PROVIDED IN THIS AGREEMENT, SELLER MAKES NO OTHER WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING ANY WARRANTY OF MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

---

### 6. COVENANTS

6.1 **Seller’s Covenants.** Seller shall:

  (a) Deliver the Goods in accordance with the terms of this Agreement;

  (b) Comply with all applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances in connection with the manufacture, sale, and delivery of the Goods.

6.2 **Buyer’s Covenants.** Buyer shall:

  (a) Pay the Purchase Price in accordance with Section 3;

  (b) Cooperate with Seller to facilitate delivery and acceptance of the Goods.

---

### 7. INDEMNIFICATION

7.1 **By Seller.** Seller shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Buyer and its affiliates, officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, damages, losses, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys’ fees) arising out of or relating to:

  (a) Any breach by Seller of its representations, warranties, or covenants under this Agreement;

  (b) Any claim that the Goods infringe any intellectual property right of a third party.

7.2 **By Buyer.** Buyer shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Seller and its affiliates, officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, damages, losses, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys’ fees) arising out of or relating to:

  (a) Any breach by Buyer of its representations, warranties, or covenants under this Agreement.

---

### 8. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY

8.1 **Limitation.** EXCEPT FOR LIABILITY ARISING FROM A PARTY’S GROSS NEGLIGENCE, WILLFUL MISCONDUCT, OR INDEMNIFICATION OBLIGATIONS UNDER SECTION 7, IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, SPECIAL, OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES, INCLUDING LOSS OF PROFITS OR REVENUE, ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT, OR OTHERWISE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.

8.2 **Cap on Liability.** EXCEPT FOR LIABILITY ARISING FROM A PARTY’S GROSS NEGLIGENCE, WILLFUL MISCONDUCT, OR INDEMNIFICATION OBLIGATIONS UNDER SECTION 7, THE AGGREGATE LIABILITY OF EITHER PARTY UNDER THIS AGREEMENT SHALL NOT EXCEED THE PURCHASE PRICE PAID BY BUYER TO SELLER.

---

### 9. CONFIDENTIALITY

9.1 **Obligation.** Each Party agrees to keep confidential and not disclose to any third party any non-public information received from the other Party in connection with this Agreement, except as required by law or with the prior written consent of the disclosing Party.

9.2 **Exceptions.** The obligations in Section 9.1 shall not apply to information that:

  (a) Is or becomes publicly available through no fault of the receiving Party;

  (b) Is lawfully received from a third party without restriction;

  (c) Is independently developed by the receiving Party without use of or reference to the disclosing Party’s confidential information.

9.3 **Survival.** The obligations of confidentiality under this Section 9 shall survive for three (3) years following the expiration or termination of this Agreement.

---

### 10. TERM AND TERMINATION

10.1 **Term.** This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and continue until all obligations of the Parties have been fulfilled, unless earlier terminated as provided herein.

10.2 **Termination for Cause.** Either Party may terminate this Agreement upon written notice to the other Party if the other Party materially breaches any provision of this Agreement and fails to cure such breach within fifteen (15) Business Days after receipt of written notice thereof.

10.3 **Termination for Insolvency.** Either Party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice if the other Party becomes insolvent, files for bankruptcy, or has a receiver appointed for substantially all of its assets.

10.4 **Effect of Termination.** Upon termination of this Agreement:

  (a) Buyer shall pay Seller for all Goods delivered and accepted prior to the effective date of termination;

  (b) Each Party shall return or destroy all confidential information of the other Party in its possession, in accordance with Section 9.

10.5 **Survival.** The provisions of Sections 5, 7, 8, 9, 11, 12, and 14 shall survive any expiration or termination of this Agreement.

---

### 11. DISPUTE RESOLUTION

11.1 **Negotiation.** In the event of any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, the Parties shall first attempt in good faith to resolve such dispute by negotiation between senior executives of each Party.

11.2 **Mediation.** If the dispute is not resolved within fifteen (15) Business Days after initiation of negotiation, either Party may submit the dispute to non-binding mediation administered by the American Arbitration Association (“AAA”) under its Commercial Mediation Procedures. The mediation shall take place in [City, State], unless otherwise agreed.

11.3 **Arbitration.** If the dispute is not resolved by mediation within thirty (30) Business Days after commencement of mediation, the dispute shall be finally resolved by binding arbitration administered by the AAA in accordance with its Commercial Arbitration Rules. The arbitration shall take place in [City, State], before a single arbitrator. Judgment on the award rendered by the arbitrator may be entered in any court having jurisdiction.

11.4 **Interim Relief.** Notwithstanding the foregoing, either Party may seek interim or injunctive relief in any court of competent jurisdiction to prevent irreparable harm pending the outcome of mediation or arbitration.

11.5 **Attorneys’ Fees.** The prevailing Party in any arbitration or legal proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall be entitled to recover its reasonable attorneys’ fees and costs.

---

### 12. NOTICES

12.1 **Method of Notice.** All notices, requests, consents, claims, demands, waivers, and other communications under this Agreement must be in writing and delivered by personal delivery, nationally recognized overnight courier, certified or registered mail (postage prepaid, return receipt requested), or email (with confirmation of receipt), to the addresses set forth above or to such other address as may be designated by a Party in writing.

12.2 **Deemed Receipt.** Notices shall be deemed received:

  (a) On the date of delivery if delivered personally;

  (b) On the next Business Day after dispatch if sent by overnight courier;

  (c) On the third Business Day after mailing if sent by certified or registered mail;

  (d) On the date sent if sent by email with confirmation of receipt.

---

### 13. FORCE MAJEURE

13.1 **Definition.** Neither Party shall be liable for any failure or delay in performing its obligations under this Agreement (other than payment obligations) if such failure or delay is caused by a Force Majeure Event, including but not limited to acts of God, war, terrorism, civil unrest, strikes, labor disputes, epidemics, fire, flood, earthquake, or other natural disasters, or governmental action.

13.2 **Notice and Mitigation.** The affected Party shall promptly notify the other Party in writing of the occurrence of a Force Majeure Event and shall use commercially reasonable efforts to mitigate the effects thereof.

13.3 **Termination for Extended Force Majeure.** If a Force Majeure Event continues for more than thirty (30) consecutive days, either Party may terminate this Agreement upon written notice to the other Party.

---

### 14. MISCELLANEOUS

14.1 **Entire Agreement.** This Agreement, including all Exhibits, constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous agreements, understandings, and representations, whether oral or written.

14.2 **Amendment.** No amendment or modification of this Agreement shall be valid unless in writing and signed by both Parties.

14.3 **Assignment.** Neither Party may assign or transfer this Agreement or any of its rights or obligations hereunder without the prior written consent of the other Party, except that either Party may assign this Agreement in connection with a merger, acquisition, or sale of substantially all of its assets.

14.4 **Severability.** If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid, illegal, or unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall remain in full force and effect.

14.5 **Waiver.** No waiver of any provision of this Agreement shall be effective unless in writing and signed by the Party against whom the waiver is sought to be enforced. No waiver of any breach shall be deemed a waiver of any subsequent breach.

14.6 **Governing Law.** This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of [Governing Law State], without regard to its conflict of laws principles.

14.7 **Counterparts.** This Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument. Electronic signatures shall be deemed to have the same legal effect as originals.

14.8 **No Third-Party Beneficiaries.** This Agreement is for the sole benefit of the Parties and their respective successors and permitted assigns, and nothing herein, express or implied, is intended to or shall confer upon any other person or entity any legal or equitable right, benefit, or remedy.

---

**IN W

PURCHASE AGREEMENT

This Purchase Agreement (the "Agreement") is made and entered into as of June 1, 2024 (the "Effective Date"), by and between:

SELLER: Orion Technologies, Inc., a Delaware corporation, with its principal place of business at 1200 Innovation Drive, Wilmington, DE 19801 ("Seller")

and

BUYER: Helios Solutions LLC, a New York limited liability company, with its principal place of business at 88 Madison Avenue, New York, NY 10016 ("Buyer").

RECITALS

WHEREAS, Seller is engaged in the business of manufacturing and selling advanced networking hardware;

WHEREAS, Buyer desires to purchase from Seller, and Seller desires to sell to Buyer, certain products as described herein, subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and promises contained herein, the parties agree as follows:

1. DEFINITIONS

1.1 "Products" means the networking hardware and related accessories described in Exhibit A attached hereto and incorporated herein by reference.

1.2 "Purchase Price" means the total amount payable by Buyer to Seller for the Products, as set forth in Section 3.1.

1.3 "Delivery Date" means the date by which Seller is required to deliver the Products to Buyer, as specified in Section 4.1.

1.4 "Business Day" means any day other than a Saturday, Sunday, or federal holiday in the State of Delaware.

2. SALE OF PRODUCTS

2.1 Sale. Seller agrees to sell, transfer, and deliver to Buyer, and Buyer agrees to purchase from Seller, the Products, subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.

2.2 Title and Risk of Loss. Title to and risk of loss of the Products shall pass to Buyer upon delivery of the Products to Buyer’s designated carrier at Seller’s facility.

3. PURCHASE PRICE AND PAYMENT TERMS

3.1 Purchase Price. The total Purchase Price for the Products shall be One Hundred Fifty Thousand Dollars ($150,000), payable in accordance with Section 3.2.

3.2 Payment Terms. Buyer shall pay the Purchase Price as follows:
  (a) An initial deposit of $30,000 within five (5) Business Days of the Effective Date;
  (b) The remaining balance of $120,000 shall be paid in two equal installments of $60,000 each, the first due on or before July 1, 2024, and the second due on or before August 1, 2024.

3.3 Late Payment. Any payment not received by Seller within ten (10) days of the due date shall accrue interest at a rate of 1.5% per month, or the maximum rate permitted by law, whichever is less.

3.4 Taxes. Buyer shall be responsible for all sales, use, excise, and other taxes applicable to the sale of the Products, except for taxes based on Seller’s income.

4. DELIVERY

4.1 Delivery Date. Seller shall deliver the Products to Buyer’s designated carrier on or before July 15, 2024.

4.2 Delays. If Seller anticipates that it will be unable to deliver the Products by the Delivery Date, Seller shall promptly notify Buyer in writing. In such event, Buyer may, at its option, (a) extend the Delivery Date by up to thirty (30) days, or (b) terminate this Agreement upon written notice to Seller.

4.3 Partial Delivery. Seller may make partial deliveries of the Products, provided that all Products are delivered no later than July 31, 2024.

4.4 Inspection. Buyer shall have five (5) Business Days after receipt of the Products to inspect them for conformity with the specifications set forth in Exhibit A. If Buyer determines that any Products do not conform, Buyer shall notify Seller in writing within such period, specifying the nonconformity in reasonable detail.

5. WARRANTIES

5.1 Seller’s Warranty. Seller warrants that the Products shall be free from defects in material and workmanship for a period of twelve (12) months from the date of delivery.

5.2 Disclaimer. EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY PROVIDED IN SECTION 5.1, SELLER MAKES NO OTHER WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION ANY IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

5.3 Remedies. In the event of a breach of the warranty set forth in Section 5.1, Seller’s sole obligation and Buyer’s exclusive remedy shall be, at Seller’s option, to repair or replace the defective Products or to refund the Purchase Price paid for such Products.

6. CONFIDENTIALITY

6.1 Confidential Information. Each party agrees to maintain in confidence all non-public information disclosed by the other party in connection with this Agreement, and to use such information solely for the purposes of performing its obligations hereunder.

6.2 Exceptions. The obligations of confidentiality shall not apply to information that (a) is or becomes publicly available through no fault of the receiving party, (b) is rightfully received from a third party without restriction, or (c) is independently developed by the receiving party without use of the disclosing party’s confidential information.

7. INDEMNIFICATION

7.1 By Seller. Seller shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Buyer and its affiliates from and against any and all claims, damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys’ fees) arising out of or relating to (a) any breach by Seller of its representations, warranties, or obligations under this Agreement, or (b) any claim that the Products infringe any intellectual property right of a third party.

7.2 By Buyer. Buyer shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Seller and its affiliates from and against any and all claims, damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys’ fees) arising out of or relating to (a) any breach by Buyer of its representations, warranties, or obligations under this Agreement, or (b) Buyer’s use or resale of the Products.

8. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY

8.1 Limitation. IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.

8.2 Cap. EXCEPT FOR LIABILITY ARISING UNDER SECTION 7 (INDEMNIFICATION), EACH PARTY’S AGGREGATE LIABILITY UNDER THIS AGREEMENT SHALL NOT EXCEED THE PURCHASE PRICE PAID BY BUYER TO SELLER.

9. TERMINATION

9.1 Termination for Cause. Either party may terminate this Agreement upon written notice to the other party if the other party materially breaches any provision of this Agreement and fails to cure such breach within thirty (30) days after receipt of written notice thereof.

9.2 Termination for Convenience. Buyer may terminate this Agreement for any reason upon thirty (30) days’ prior written notice to Seller. In such event, Buyer shall pay Seller for all Products delivered and accepted prior to the effective date of termination.

9.3 Effect of Termination. Upon termination of this Agreement for any reason, each party shall promptly return or destroy all confidential information of the other party.

10. FORCE MAJEURE

10.1 Neither party shall be liable for any failure or delay in performance under this Agreement (other than for payment obligations) due to causes beyond its reasonable control, including acts of God, war, terrorism, labor disputes, or governmental actions, provided that the affected party promptly notifies the other party and uses reasonable efforts to resume performance.

11. NOTICES

11.1 All notices required or permitted under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed given when delivered personally, sent by certified mail (return receipt requested), or by nationally recognized overnight courier, to the addresses set forth above or such other address as either party may designate by notice to the other.

12. ASSIGNMENT

12.1 Neither party may assign or transfer this Agreement or any of its rights or obligations hereunder without the prior written consent of the other party, except that either party may assign this Agreement without consent to a successor in interest by merger, acquisition, or sale of substantially all of its assets.

13. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION

13.1 This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware, without regard to its conflict of law principles.

13.2 Any legal action or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall be brought exclusively in the state or federal courts located in New York County, New York, and each party hereby irrevocably submits to the jurisdiction of such courts.

14. ENTIRE AGREEMENT; AMENDMENT

14.1 This Agreement, including all exhibits and attachments hereto, constitutes the entire agreement between the parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous agreements, proposals, and communications, whether oral or written.

14.2 This Agreement may be amended or modified only by a written instrument executed by both parties.

15. SEVERABILITY

15.1 If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall remain in full force and effect.

16. COUNTERPARTS

16.1 This Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Purchase Agreement as of the Effective Date.

SELLER: Orion Technologies, Inc.
By: __________________________
Name: ________________________
Title: _________________________
Date: _________________________

BUYER: Helios Solutions LLC
By: __________________________
Name: ________________________
Title: _________________________
Date: _________________________

EXHIBIT A

Description of Products:
- OrionNet Switch Model X1000 (Qty: 50)
- OrionNet Router Model R500 (Qty: 30)
- OrionNet SFP+ Module (Qty: 100)

Specifications: As per Seller’s published technical datasheets as of the Effective Date.

Delivery Location: Buyer’s warehouse at 88 Madison Avenue, New York, NY 10016.
known_contradictions: Conflicting Payment Schedules: Section 3.1 states the total Purchase Price is $150,000, but Section 3.2(b) requires two equal installments of $60,000 each (totaling $120,000) after the $30,000 deposit, which only adds up to $150,000. However, Section 3.2(b) also refers to the 'remaining balance' as $120,000, which is correct, but the installment structure could be interpreted as inconsistent if the deposit is not properly credited.

Conflicting Delivery Dates: Section 4.1 states Seller must deliver the Products on or before July 15, 2024, but Section 4.3 allows partial deliveries provided all Products are delivered no later than July 31, 2024, creating ambiguity as to the final permissible delivery date.

Contradictory Governing Law and Jurisdiction: Section 13.1 states the Agreement is governed by Delaware law, but Section 13.2 requires that any legal action be brought exclusively in New York courts, creating a conflict between the governing law and the forum for disputes.

Mismatched Definition vs Usage: Section 1.1 defines 'Products' as those described in Exhibit A, but Section 5.3 refers to 'such Products' in the context of a refund, which could be interpreted as referring to only defective Products, not the entire set of Products as defined, leading to ambiguity in the scope of the refund obligation.

text:
EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT

This Employment Agreement ("Agreement") is made and entered into as of [Date], by and between [Employer's Name], a [State] corporation with its principal place of business at [Employer's Address] ("Employer"), and [Employee's Name], residing at [Employee's Address] ("Employee").

1. **Position and Duties**

   1.1 **Position**: Employer hereby employs Employee as [Position Title]. Employee accepts such employment and agrees to perform the duties and responsibilities as outlined in Exhibit A attached hereto and incorporated herein by reference.

   1.2 **Duties**: Employee shall perform all duties and responsibilities in a professional and diligent manner, consistent with the standards of the industry and as directed by Employer. Employee agrees to devote full-time efforts to the business and affairs of the Employer.

2. **Term of Employment**

   2.1 **Initial Term**: The term of this Agreement shall commence on [Start Date] and continue for a period of [Number] years, unless earlier terminated in accordance with Section 7 of this Agreement.

   2.2 **Renewal**: This Agreement shall automatically renew for successive one-year terms unless either party provides written notice of non-renewal at least 60 days prior to the expiration of the then-current term.

3. **Compensation and Benefits**

   3.1 **Salary**: Employer shall pay Employee an annual salary of [Salary Amount], payable in accordance with Employer's standard payroll practices.

   3.2 **Bonus**: Employee shall be eligible for an annual performance bonus, subject to the terms and conditions of the Employer's bonus plan, as determined by the Employer in its sole discretion.

   3.3 **Benefits**: Employee shall be entitled to participate in all employee benefit plans and programs generally available to Employer's employees, subject to the terms and conditions of such plans and programs.

   3.4 **Expenses**: Employer shall reimburse Employee for all reasonable and necessary business expenses incurred in the performance of Employee's duties, in accordance with Employer's expense reimbursement policy.

4. **Confidentiality and Proprietary Information**

   4.1 **Confidentiality**: Employee acknowledges that during the course of employment, Employee will have access to confidential and proprietary information. Employee agrees to maintain the confidentiality of such information and not to disclose it to any third party without the prior written consent of Employer.

   4.2 **Return of Property**: Upon termination of employment, Employee agrees to return all Employer property, including but not limited to documents, equipment, and proprietary information.

5. **Non-Competition and Non-Solicitation**

   5.1 **Non-Competition**: During the term of this Agreement and for a period of [Number] months following termination, Employee shall not engage in any business activities that are competitive with the business of Employer within [Geographic Area].

   5.2 **Non-Solicitation**: Employee agrees that during the term of this Agreement and for a period of [Number] months following termination, Employee will not solicit or attempt to solicit any of Employer's employees or customers.

6. **Intellectual Property**

   6.1 **Ownership**: Employee agrees that any and all inventions, discoveries, developments, and innovations conceived by Employee during the term of employment, solely or jointly with others, that relate to the business of Employer, shall be the exclusive property of Employer.

   6.2 **Assignment**: Employee hereby assigns to Employer all rights, title, and interest in and to any such inventions, discoveries, developments, and innovations.

7. **Termination**

   7.1 **Termination by Employer**: Employer may terminate this Agreement at any time for Cause, as defined herein, or without Cause upon [Number] days' written notice to Employee.

   7.2 **Termination by Employee**: Employee may terminate this Agreement at any time upon [Number] days' written notice to Employer.

   7.3 **Cause**: For purposes of this Agreement, "Cause" shall mean (i) Employee's willful misconduct or gross negligence in the performance of duties, (ii) Employee's breach of any material provision of this Agreement, or (iii) Employee's conviction of a felony.

8. **Dispute Resolution**

   8.1 **Arbitration**: Any dispute arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall be resolved by binding arbitration in accordance with the rules of the American Arbitration Association. The arbitration shall be conducted in [City, State].

   8.2 **Governing Law**: This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of [State], without regard to its conflict of laws principles.

9. **Miscellaneous**

   9.1 **Entire Agreement**: This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties and supersedes all prior agreements and understandings, whether written or oral, relating to the subject matter hereof.

   9.2 **Amendments**: This Agreement may be amended only by a written instrument signed by both parties.

   9.3 **Severability**: If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall continue in full force and effect.

   9.4 **Waiver**: The waiver by either party of a breach of any provision of this Agreement shall not operate or be construed as a waiver of any subsequent breach.

   9.5 **Notices**: Any notice required or permitted to be given under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been given when delivered personally, sent by certified mail, or sent by a recognized overnight courier service to the addresses set forth above.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Employment Agreement as of the date first above written.

[Employer's Name]  
By: ___________________________  
Name: [Name]  
Title: [Title]  

[Employee's Name]  
By: ___________________________  
Name: [Employee's Name]  

**Exhibit A**: Duties and Responsibilities of [Position Title]  
[Detailed description of duties and responsibilities]

known_contradictions: Conflicting dates: Section 2.1 states the term ends on October 31, 2025, but Section 2.2 implies the term could end earlier if notice is given 60 days prior to the end of the term, which would be August 31, 2025.

Inconsistent payment amounts/schedules: Section 3.1 states the salary is $120,000 payable bi-weekly, but Section 3.3 implies a salary review on January 1, 2024, which could change the salary before the end of the first year.
Conflicting jurisdiction/governing law clauses: Section 7.1 states the governing law is Delaware, but Section 7.2 states disputes will be resolved in New York courts.

Mismatched definitions vs usage: Section 5.2 defines the non-compete radius as fifty (50) miles, but does not specify whether this is from the principal place of business or any other location, leading to potential ambiguity.

SERVICE AGREEMENT

This Service Agreement ("Agreement") is entered into as of [Date] ("Effective Date"), by and between [Client's Full Legal Name], with a principal place of business at [Client's Address] ("Client"), and [Service Provider's Full Legal Name], with a principal place of business at [Service Provider's Address] ("Service Provider"). Client and Service Provider may be referred to individually as a "Party" or collectively as the "Parties."

1. **SERVICES**

   1.1 **Scope of Services**. Service Provider agrees to provide the services described in Exhibit A attached hereto and incorporated herein by reference ("Services").

   1.2 **Performance Standards**. Service Provider shall perform the Services in a professional and workmanlike manner in accordance with industry standards and the specifications set forth in Exhibit A.

2. **TERM AND TERMINATION**

   2.1 **Term**. This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for a period of [Number] years, unless earlier terminated in accordance with this Agreement.

   2.2 **Termination for Convenience**. Either Party may terminate this Agreement for any reason upon [Number] days' written notice to the other Party.

   2.3 **Termination for Cause**. Either Party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice if the other Party breaches any material term of this Agreement and fails to cure such breach within [Number] days after receipt of written notice of the breach.

   2.4 **Effect of Termination**. Upon termination of this Agreement, Service Provider shall cease all Services and deliver to Client all work in progress. Client shall pay Service Provider for all Services performed up to the date of termination.

3. **COMPENSATION**

   3.1 **Fees**. Client shall pay Service Provider the fees set forth in Exhibit B attached hereto and incorporated herein by reference ("Fees").

   3.2 **Expenses**. Client shall reimburse Service Provider for all reasonable and necessary expenses incurred in connection with the performance of the Services, provided that such expenses are pre-approved by Client in writing.

   3.3 **Payment Terms**. Service Provider shall invoice Client monthly for Services rendered and expenses incurred. Client shall pay all undisputed amounts within [Number] days of receipt of an invoice.

4. **CONFIDENTIALITY**

   4.1 **Confidential Information**. Each Party agrees to keep confidential all non-public information disclosed by the other Party in connection with this Agreement ("Confidential Information").

   4.2 **Exclusions**. Confidential Information does not include information that is (a) publicly available, (b) already known to the receiving Party, (c) independently developed by the receiving Party, or (d) rightfully obtained from a third party.

   4.3 **Obligations**. Each Party agrees not to disclose the other Party's Confidential Information to any third party and to use such Confidential Information only for the purposes of performing its obligations under this Agreement.

5. **INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY**

   5.1 **Ownership**. All intellectual property rights in any work product created by Service Provider in connection with the Services ("Work Product") shall be owned by Client upon payment in full of all Fees.

   5.2 **License**. Service Provider grants to Client a perpetual, irrevocable, worldwide, royalty-free license to use, reproduce, and modify the Work Product for Client's internal business purposes.

6. **REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES**

   6.1 **Mutual Representations**. Each Party represents and warrants that (a) it has the full right and authority to enter into this Agreement, and (b) its performance under this Agreement will not violate any applicable law or regulation.

   6.2 **Service Provider's Warranties**. Service Provider represents and warrants that (a) the Services will be performed in a professional and workmanlike manner, and (b) the Work Product will not infringe any third-party intellectual property rights.

7. **INDEMNIFICATION**

   7.1 **By Service Provider**. Service Provider shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Client from and against any and all claims, liabilities, damages, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of or in connection with (a) Service Provider's breach of this Agreement, or (b) any claim that the Work Product infringes any third-party intellectual property rights.

   7.2 **By Client**. Client shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Service Provider from and against any and all claims, liabilities, damages, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of or in connection with Client's breach of this Agreement.

8. **LIMITATION OF LIABILITY**

   8.1 **Exclusion of Damages**. In no event shall either Party be liable to the other for any indirect, incidental, consequential, special, or punitive damages arising out of or in connection with this Agreement.

   8.2 **Cap on Liability**. Each Party's total liability to the other Party for any and all claims arising out of or in connection with this Agreement shall not exceed the total Fees paid by Client to Service Provider under this Agreement.

9. **DISPUTE RESOLUTION**

   9.1 **Negotiation**. The Parties shall attempt in good faith to resolve any dispute arising out of or in connection with this Agreement through negotiation.

   9.2 **Mediation**. If the dispute is not resolved through negotiation within [Number] days, the Parties agree to submit the dispute to mediation administered by [Mediation Organization] under its rules.

   9.3 **Arbitration**. If the dispute is not resolved through mediation, it shall be finally resolved by binding arbitration conducted in [Location] in accordance with the rules of [Arbitration Organization]. The arbitrator's decision shall be final and binding on the Parties.

10. **GENERAL PROVISIONS**

   10.1 **Governing Law**. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of [State], without regard to its conflict of laws principles.

   10.2 **Entire Agreement**. This Agreement, including all exhibits, constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties and supersedes all prior agreements and understandings, whether written or oral, relating to the subject matter hereof.

   10.3 **Amendments**. This Agreement may be amended only by a written agreement signed by both Parties.

   10.4 **Waiver**. No waiver of any term or condition of this Agreement shall be effective unless in writing and signed by the Party against whom enforcement is sought.

   10.5 **Severability**. If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall continue in full force and effect.

   10.6 **Assignment**. Neither Party may assign this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other Party, except that either Party may assign this Agreement to a successor in interest in connection with a merger, acquisition, or sale of all or substantially all of its assets.

   10.7 **Notices**. All notices required or permitted under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed given when delivered personally, sent by confirmed email, or sent by certified mail, return receipt requested, to the addresses set forth above or to such other address as a Party may specify in writing.

   10.8 **Counterparts**. This Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Agreement as of the Effective Date.

[Client's Full Legal Name]  
By: ___________________________  
Name: _________________________  
Title: __________________________  

[Service Provider's Full Legal Name]  
By: ___________________________  
Name: _________________________  
Title: __________________________  

**EXHIBIT A**  
**Description of Services**

[Detailed description of the services to be provided by Service Provider]

**EXHIBIT B**  
**Fees**

[Detailed description of the fees to be paid by Client to Service Provider]

known_contradictions: Conflicting payment terms: Section 2.1 states monthly payments of $10,000, while Section 2.2 specifies an initial payment of $15,000 and monthly payments of $9,545.45.
Conflicting governing law clauses: Section 7.1 states the contract is governed by New York law, while Section 7.2 states disputes are subject to California jurisdiction.
Conflicting service commencement dates: Section 1.2 states services commence on November 15, 2023, but the contract is effective as of November 1, 2023.
Inconsistent termination notice period: Section 5.1 allows termination with thirty (30) days' notice, but Section 5.2 allows immediate termination for breach with a ten (10) day cure period.

RENTAL AGREEMENT CONTRACT

This Rental Agreement ("Agreement") is made and entered into as of the [Insert Date] by and between [Landlord's Full Name], hereinafter referred to as "Landlord," and [Tenant's Full Name], hereinafter referred to as "Tenant." The Landlord and Tenant may collectively be referred to as the "Parties."

1. PREMISES
The Landlord hereby rents to the Tenant, and the Tenant hereby rents from the Landlord, the residential premises located at [Full Address of the Property], hereinafter referred to as the "Premises."

2. TERM
The term of this Agreement shall commence on [Start Date] and shall continue until [End Date], unless terminated earlier in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement. This Agreement may be renewed upon mutual written consent of both Parties.

3. RENT
The Tenant agrees to pay the Landlord a monthly rent of [Rent Amount] due on the first day of each month. Rent payments shall be made via [Payment Method] to [Payment Details]. Any rent payment not received by the fifth day of the month shall be considered late and subject to a late fee of [Late Fee Amount].

4. SECURITY DEPOSIT
The Tenant shall deposit with the Landlord the sum of [Security Deposit Amount] as a security deposit. The security deposit shall be held by the Landlord as security for the performance of the Tenant's obligations under this Agreement. The Landlord shall return the security deposit to the Tenant within [Number of Days] days after the termination of this Agreement, less any deductions for damages or unpaid rent.

5. UTILITIES
The Tenant shall be responsible for the payment of all utilities and services for the Premises, including but not limited to electricity, gas, water, sewage, and trash collection, unless otherwise agreed in writing.

6. USE OF PREMISES
The Premises shall be used and occupied by the Tenant exclusively as a private single-family dwelling. The Tenant shall not use the Premises for any unlawful purpose or in any manner that would violate any applicable law or regulation.

7. MAINTENANCE AND REPAIRS
The Tenant shall keep the Premises in a clean and sanitary condition and shall promptly notify the Landlord of any damage or need for repairs. The Landlord shall be responsible for all major repairs and maintenance, except those caused by the negligence or misuse of the Tenant.

8. ALTERATIONS
The Tenant shall not make any alterations, additions, or improvements to the Premises without the prior written consent of the Landlord. Any approved alterations shall become the property of the Landlord upon termination of this Agreement.

9. PET POLICY
[Choose one: Pets are not allowed on the Premises. OR Pets are allowed on the Premises subject to the following conditions: [List Conditions].]

10. INSURANCE
The Tenant is encouraged to obtain renter's insurance to cover personal property and liability. The Landlord shall not be liable for any loss or damage to the Tenant's personal property.

11. ENTRY BY LANDLORD
The Landlord may enter the Premises at reasonable times to inspect, make repairs, or show the Premises to prospective tenants or buyers, provided that the Landlord gives the Tenant at least [Number of Hours] hours' notice, except in the case of an emergency.

12. DEFAULT
If the Tenant fails to pay rent or breaches any other term of this Agreement, the Landlord may terminate this Agreement by providing written notice to the Tenant. The Tenant shall have [Number of Days] days to cure the default, failing which the Landlord may pursue legal remedies.

13. DISPUTE RESOLUTION
In the event of any dispute arising out of or relating to this Agreement, the Parties agree to first attempt to resolve the dispute through mediation. If mediation fails, the dispute shall be resolved by binding arbitration in accordance with the rules of the [Arbitration Association]. The arbitration shall take place in [City, State].

14. GOVERNING LAW
This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of [State].

15. ENTIRE AGREEMENT
This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties and supersedes all prior agreements or understandings, whether written or oral, relating to the subject matter hereof.

16. AMENDMENTS
This Agreement may be amended only by a written document signed by both Parties.

17. SEVERABILITY
If any provision of this Agreement is found to be invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall continue in full force and effect.

18. NOTICES
Any notice required or permitted under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed delivered when delivered in person or deposited in the United States mail, postage prepaid, addressed to the Party at the address set forth below:

Landlord: [Landlord's Address]
Tenant: [Tenant's Address]

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Agreement as of the date first above written.

_____________________________  
[Landlord's Full Name]  
Landlord

_____________________________  
[Tenant's Full Name]  
Tenant

[Witness Signature, if applicable]  
[Date]

known_contradictions: Conflicting jurisdiction/governing law clauses: Section 10 states the Agreement is governed by the laws of the State of Confusion, but disputes are resolved in the courts located in Springfield, State of Harmony.
Inconsistent payment amounts/schedules: Section 3 states the monthly rent is $1,200.00, but the security deposit in Section 4 is also $1,200.00, which is typically a different amount.

Conflicting dates or terms: Section 11 allows termination with 60 days notice, but also states the Landlord can terminate with 30 days notice in case of breach, creating ambiguity in termination terms.

Mismatched definitions vs usage: Section 5 defines the use of Premises as a private single-family residence, but does not specify if this includes or excludes home-based businesses, which could conflict with Section 5's prohibition of unlawful use.

**PURCHASE AGREEMENT CONTRACT**

**This Purchase Agreement ("Agreement") is made and entered into as of [Date], by and between [Seller's Full Legal Name], with a principal place of business at [Seller's Address] ("Seller"), and [Buyer's Full Legal Name], with a principal place of business at [Buyer's Address] ("Buyer").**

**RECITALS**

WHEREAS, Seller desires to sell, and Buyer desires to purchase, certain goods and/or services as described herein, subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement.

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and promises contained herein, the parties agree as follows:

**1. DEFINITIONS**

1.1 "Goods" shall mean the products described in Exhibit A attached hereto.

1.2 "Purchase Price" shall mean the total amount payable by Buyer to Seller for the Goods as specified in Section 3.

1.3 "Delivery Date" shall mean the date by which the Goods are to be delivered to Buyer, as specified in Section 4.

1.4 "Effective Date" shall mean the date first written above.

**2. SALE OF GOODS**

2.1 Seller agrees to sell, and Buyer agrees to purchase, the Goods described in Exhibit A, attached hereto and incorporated herein by reference.

2.2 The sale of Goods shall be on an "as is" basis, and Seller makes no warranties, express or implied, except as expressly stated in this Agreement.

**3. PURCHASE PRICE AND PAYMENT TERMS**

3.1 The Purchase Price for the Goods shall be [Purchase Price Amount], payable in [Currency].

3.2 Buyer shall pay the Purchase Price to Seller in full within [Number] days from the Delivery Date.

3.3 All payments shall be made via [Payment Method] to the account designated by Seller.

**4. DELIVERY**

4.1 Seller shall deliver the Goods to Buyer on or before [Delivery Date] at [Delivery Location].

4.2 Risk of loss and title to the Goods shall pass to Buyer upon delivery.

4.3 If Seller fails to deliver the Goods by the Delivery Date, Buyer may, at its option, terminate this Agreement without penalty.

**5. INSPECTION AND ACCEPTANCE**

5.1 Buyer shall have [Number] days from the Delivery Date to inspect the Goods.

5.2 If Buyer determines that the Goods do not conform to the specifications set forth in Exhibit A, Buyer shall notify Seller in writing within the inspection period.

5.3 Upon receipt of such notice, Seller shall have [Number] days to cure any non-conformity.

**6. WARRANTIES**

6.1 Seller warrants that the Goods shall conform to the specifications set forth in Exhibit A.

6.2 Seller warrants that it has good and marketable title to the Goods, free and clear of all liens and encumbrances.

**7. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY**

7.1 In no event shall Seller be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages arising out of or in connection with this Agreement.

7.2 Seller's total liability under this Agreement shall not exceed the Purchase Price.

**8. INDEMNIFICATION**

8.1 Buyer agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Seller from any and all claims, liabilities, damages, and expenses arising out of Buyer's use of the Goods.

**9. CONFIDENTIALITY**

9.1 Both parties agree to keep confidential any proprietary information disclosed by the other party in connection with this Agreement.

9.2 This obligation shall survive the termination of this Agreement.

**10. TERMINATION**

10.1 Either party may terminate this Agreement upon written notice if the other party breaches any material term of this Agreement and fails to cure such breach within [Number] days of receiving notice thereof.

10.2 Upon termination, Buyer shall return any Goods not paid for, and Seller shall refund any payments made for undelivered Goods.

**11. DISPUTE RESOLUTION**

11.1 Any dispute arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall be resolved through negotiation between the parties.

11.2 If the parties are unable to resolve the dispute through negotiation, the dispute shall be submitted to binding arbitration in accordance with the rules of the [Arbitration Association].

11.3 The arbitration shall be conducted in [Location], and the language of the arbitration shall be [Language].

**12. GOVERNING LAW**

12.1 This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of [State], without regard to its conflict of laws principles.

**13. MISCELLANEOUS**

13.1 Entire Agreement. This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties and supersedes all prior agreements and understandings, whether written or oral.

13.2 Amendments. This Agreement may only be amended by a written document signed by both parties.

13.3 Severability. If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall continue in full force and effect.

13.4 Waiver. No waiver of any breach of this Agreement shall be deemed a waiver of any subsequent breach.

13.5 Assignment. Neither party may assign its rights or obligations under this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other party.

13.6 Notices. All notices required or permitted under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed delivered when delivered in person, by overnight courier, or by certified mail, return receipt requested, to the addresses set forth above.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Agreement as of the Effective Date.

**SELLER:**

[Seller's Full Legal Name]

By: ___________________________

Name: [Name]

Title: [Title]

Date: [Date]

**BUYER:**

[Buyer's Full Legal Name]

By: ___________________________

Name: [Name]

Title: [Title]

Date: [Date]

**EXHIBIT A**

[Description of Goods]

text:
EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT

This Employment Agreement (“Agreement”) is made and entered into as of April 1, 2023 (“Effective Date”), by and between Suncrest Innovations, Inc., a Delaware corporation having its principal place of business at 1234 Elm Street, Wilmington, DE 19801 (“Employer”), and Jordan A. Smith, an individual residing at 789 Maple Avenue, Wilmington, DE 19801 (“Employee”). Employer and Employee may hereinafter be referred to individually as a “Party” and collectively as the “Parties.”

1. DEFINITIONS AND INTERPRETATION  
1.1. Definitions. For the purposes of this Agreement, the following terms shall have the meanings indicated:  
  (a) “Confidential Information” means all data, materials, products, technology, computer programs, specifications, manuals, business plans, software, marketing plans, financial information, and other information disclosed or supplied in any form by Employer to Employee, whether orally or in writing, and that has been designated as confidential or that reasonably should be understood to be confidential given the nature of the information and the circumstances of disclosure.  
  (b) “Company Policies” means the policies, procedures, and guidelines provided by Employer which shall be in effect from time to time and that are incorporated by reference herein.  
  (c) “Dispute” means any controversy, claim, or dispute between the Parties related to or arising out of this Agreement or the employment relationship established hereby.  
  (d) “Work Product” means any invention, discovery, development, improvement, trade secret, technology, or other proprietary idea that is conceived, discovered, or developed by the Employee during the course of employment, either solely or jointly with others.  
  (e) “Term” means the period during which Employee’s services shall be provided to Employer under this Agreement, as described in Section 3 below.

1.2. Interpretation. In this Agreement, unless the context clearly requires otherwise, singular words shall include the plural, and references to “Sections” refer to the numbered sections of this Agreement. Any headings are for convenience only and shall not affect the interpretation of this Agreement. Cross-references in this Agreement are accurate and refer to the correct sections, ensuring clarity of obligations and rights of the Parties.

2. APPOINTMENT AND DUTIES  
2.1. Position and Acceptance. Employer hereby employs Employee in the capacity of Senior Software Engineer. Employee hereby accepts such employment on the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement. Employee agrees to perform all duties customarily associated with such position and any additional duties as may be reasonably assigned by Employer from time to time, which will conform to Company Policies and applicable legal standards.  
2.2. Duties and Responsibilities. Employee shall be responsible for, but not limited to, the following:  
  (a) Designing, developing, testing, and maintaining software applications and solutions in accordance with Employer’s technical standards and business requirements.  
  (b) Collaborating with cross-functional teams including Product, Marketing, and Customer Support to optimize product functionality.  
  (c) Providing regular progress updates and contributing expertise towards continued product improvements.  
  (d) Maintaining accurate documentation of work performed and reporting any challenges or risks promptly.  
2.3. Best Efforts and Full Faith. Employee agrees to devote Employee’s full business time, attention, skill, and efforts to the performance of Employee’s duties hereunder. Employee shall perform such duties in a diligent, professional, and workmanlike manner that reflects favorably on the reputation and interests of Employer.

3. TERM  
3.1. Commencement and Duration. The term of this Agreement shall commence on April 1, 2023 and, unless earlier terminated pursuant to Section 7 herein, shall continue indefinitely.  
3.2. Probationary Period. For the first ninety (90) days of employment, Employee’s performance and compatibility with Employer’s operations will be subject to a probationary review. During this period, either Party may terminate the employment relationship with or without cause upon written notice.  
3.3. Renewal and Modification. The continuation or renewal of any specific terms (for example, performance bonus schemes, benefits modifications, or incentive programs) shall follow a separate written agreement and shall not modify this Agreement unless specifically referenced.

4. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS  
4.1. Base Salary. Employee will receive an annual base salary of Seventy-Five Thousand Dollars ($75,000), payable in accordance with Employer’s standard payroll practices.  
4.2. Bonus and Incentive Compensation. Employee shall be eligible to participate in Employer’s bonus program, subject to the criteria established by Employer. Any bonus awarded is discretionary and conditioned upon Employee’s performance, achievement of specific milestones, and other factors, without constituting a contractual right.  
4.3. Benefits. During the Term, Employee shall be eligible to participate in standard Employer benefits, including health insurance, retirement plan contributions, and paid time off, in accordance with Company Policies and the terms of the applicable benefit plan documents. Employer reserves the right to amend, modify, or terminate any benefit plan at its sole discretion, subject to applicable laws.  
4.4. Expense Reimbursement. Employee shall be reimbursed for all reasonable business-related expenditures incurred directly in the performance of Employee’s duties, which must be submitted under Employer’s expense reimbursement procedures and in accordance with Company Policies.  
4.5. Taxes. All compensation and benefits provided to Employee pursuant to this Agreement shall be subject to applicable withholding, reporting, and tax obligations under the law.

5. CONFIDENTIALITY, INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY, AND NON-DISCLOSURE  
5.1. Confidentiality Obligations. Employee acknowledges that in the course of employment Employee will receive or have access to Confidential Information. Employee agrees to maintain all such information in strict confidence and not to disclose or use any Confidential Information except as required in the performance of Employee’s duties for Employer.  
5.2. Work Product and Inventions. Any Work Product conceived, developed, or reduced to practice by Employee during the Term solely or jointly with others, and which relates to the business, current or anticipated research and development, or actual or demonstrable products or services of Employer, shall be the sole property of Employer. Employee agrees to assign and hereby assigns to Employer all rights, title, and interest in such Work Product.  
5.3. Return of Property. Upon termination of Employee’s employment for any reason, Employee shall return all documents, materials, or electronic devices containing any Confidential Information or other property or records belonging to Employer.  
5.4. Non-Disclosure Agreement. Employee agrees to execute and abide by any non-disclosure agreement or similar confidentiality instrument as may be provided by Employer, which shall be deemed incorporated herein by reference.

6. PERFORMANCE STANDARDS AND CONDUCT  
6.1. Performance Standards. Employee agrees to adhere to the performance expectations and quality standards established by the Employer. The Employer reserves the right to review Employee’s performance periodically and provide feedback, training, or performance improvement directives as necessary.  
6.2. Compliance with Policies. Employee shall comply with all applicable federal, state, and local laws, as well as all internal policies and procedures and Company Policies of Employer. Any violation may subject Employee to disciplinary action up to and including termination.  
6.3. Conflicts of Interest. Employee agrees to promptly disclose any potential or actual conflict of interest that might reasonably be expected to affect Employee’s independent judgment or ability to perform Employee’s duties in the best interests of Employer.  
6.4. Use of Employer Property. Employee agrees that any equipment, software, or resources provided for the performance of Employee’s duties shall be used solely for business purposes related to Employer’s business operations. Unauthorized or personal use should be limited as defined in Company Policies.

7. TERMINATION  
7.1. Termination by Employer. Employer may terminate Employee’s employment, with or without cause, upon providing at least two (2) weeks’ written notice to Employee. In cases of termination for cause, including but not limited to gross misconduct, breach of confidentiality, insubordination, or failure to perform duties, termination shall be effective immediately upon notice.  
7.2. Termination by Employee. Employee may terminate employment at any time by providing at least two (2) weeks’ written notice to Employer.  
7.3. Termination for Material Breach. In the event that either Party materially breaches any provision of this Agreement and such breach is not cured within fifteen (15) business days following written notice thereof by the non-breaching Party, the non-breaching Party may terminate this Agreement immediately.  
7.4. Effect of Termination. Upon termination of this Agreement for any reason:  
  (a) Employee shall immediately return all Employer property as specified in Section 5.3.  
  (b) Employee shall be entitled to receive any earned but unpaid salary and accrued benefits up to the termination date, subject to applicable deductions and withholdings.  
  (c) Provisions under Sections 5 (Confidentiality, Intellectual Property, and Non-Disclosure), 7.4, 8 (Dispute Resolution), and 9 (Miscellaneous) shall survive termination of this Agreement.

8. DISPUTE RESOLUTION  
8.1. Informal Resolution. In the event of any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or in connection with this Agreement (“Dispute”), the Parties agree to first attempt in good faith to resolve such Dispute informally by meeting within thirty (30) days of the notice of such Dispute. The notice shall describe in reasonable detail the nature of the Dispute and the relief sought.  
8.2. Binding Arbitration. If the Dispute cannot be satisfactorily resolved within the thirty (30) day period through informal negotiations, the Parties agree that the Dispute shall be exclusively resolved by binding arbitration in accordance with the rules of the American Arbitration Association (AAA), which rules are deemed to be incorporated by reference into this Section. The arbitration shall take place in Wilmington, DE, and shall be conducted in English.  
8.3. Final Judgment. The decision or award rendered by the arbitrator shall be final and binding upon the Parties and may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof.  
8.4. Costs and Fees. Unless otherwise determined by the arbitrator, each Party shall bear its own costs and fees associated with the arbitration proceedings. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the prevailing Party in any arbitration may be awarded reasonable attorneys’ fees and costs.  
8.5. Injunctive Relief. Notwithstanding the commencement of arbitration or any other dispute resolution process, Employee agrees that Employer shall be entitled to seek injunctive or other equitable relief concerning any breach or threatened breach of Sections 5.1 (Confidentiality) or 5.2 (Work Product and Inventions), without the posting of bond or other security.

9. MISCELLANEOUS  
9.1. Governing Law. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware, without regard to any conflict of law principles.  
9.2. Entire Agreement. This Agreement, together with any exhibits, schedules, or attachments hereto and any documents incorporated by reference pursuant to Section 5.4 or other parts of this Agreement

Mercer (the "Employee"), residing at 456 Elm Street, Springfield, IL.

WHEREAS, the Employer desires to employ the Employee and the Employee desires to accept employment with the Employer on the terms and conditions set forth herein; 

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and promises set forth herein, the parties hereto agree as follows:

1. DEFINITIONS
1.1. "Confidential Information" means all non-public information or trade secrets of the Employer which are disclosed to the Employee, including without limitation business plans, product designs, marketing strategies, financial statements, and customer lists. 
1.2. "Term" means the duration of employment as specified in Section 2 of this Agreement. 
1.3. "Work Product" means any and all ideas, inventions, discoveries, improvements, processes, designs, documentation, and other materials, whether patentable or not, that may be conceived or developed by the Employee during the term of his/her employment.
1.4. "Business Day" shall mean any day other than a Saturday, Sunday or any day recognized as a bank holiday in the jurisdiction where the Employer primarily conducts its business.

2. TERM OF EMPLOYMENT
2.1. The Employee’s employment under this Agreement shall commence on February 1, 2024 and shall continue for a period of two (2) years, unless earlier terminated as provided herein (the "Term"). Notwithstanding the foregoing, certain provisions herein specify obligations commencing from the Effective Date of January 1, 2024.
2.2. This Agreement is not automatically renewable. Any extension or renewal shall be set forth in a separate written instrument duly executed by both parties.

3. POSITION AND DUTIES
3.1. Position. The Employee is being employed in the capacity of Senior Software Engineer. The Employee shall report directly to the Director of Engineering or such other person as the Employer may designate from time to time.
3.2. Duties. The Employee shall perform such duties as are customarily associated with the position, which include but are not limited to:
   (a) Designing, coding, testing, and implementing software solutions;
   (b) Analyzing user needs and software requirements to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraints;
   (c) Collaborating with cross-functional teams to define project objectives and deliverables;
   (d) Providing technical leadership and mentoring to junior team members; and
   (e) Ensuring adherence to project deadlines and compliance with established coding standards.
3.3. Additional Responsibilities. The Employee may be assigned additional tasks or projects that are outside the scope of his/her normal duties provided that such assignments are in accordance with business needs. The Employee agrees to perform all such tasks faithfully and competently. However, the Employee shall not be held responsible for delays in project schedules that result solely from miscommunications between multiple departments.

4. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS
4.1. Base Salary. The Employer shall pay the Employee a base salary at the rate of Five Thousand Dollars ($5,000) per month, payable in accordance with the Employer’s regular payroll schedule. Notwithstanding this Section, certain disbursements outlined in Section 6 have been described as monthly installments of Six Thousand Dollars ($6,000) for performance bonuses.
4.2. Bonus. The Employee shall be eligible for an annual performance bonus. The bonus shall be determined at the sole discretion of the Employer’s management in accordance with company performance and individual performance benchmarks. In the event that the bonus program is adjusted during the term of employment, any revised bonus schedule shall be communicated in writing at least thirty (30) days in advance of the change.
4.3. Payment Schedule. Base salary payments shall be made on the last business day of each month. The Employer reserves the right to amend the payroll schedule with a thirty (30) day written notice to the Employee.
4.4. Benefits. The Employee shall be eligible to participate in the standard benefit plans that are in effect for similarly situated employees of the Employer, including health, dental, and vision insurance, subject to the terms and conditions of each respective plan. The Employer shall also contribute towards a retirement savings plan in accordance with prevailing company policy.
4.5. Expense Reimbursement. The Employer shall reimburse the Employee for all reasonable and necessary business expenses incurred in the performance of his/her duties, provided that such expenses are pre-approved by the Employee’s supervisor and are substantiated by receipts in accordance with the Employer’s reimbursement policy.

5. OBLIGATIONS AND CONDUCT
5.1. Employee Obligations. The Employee agrees to:
   (a) Devote his/her full business time, attention, and best efforts to the performance of the duties assigned under this Agreement;
   (b) Comply with all lawful policies, procedures, and rules established by the Employer;
   (c) Maintain the confidentiality of all Confidential Information both during and after the term of employment;
   (d) Promptly disclose to the Employer all inventions or improvements which relate to the Employer’s business; and
   (e) Abide by all applicable laws and regulations while performing his/her duties.
5.2. Code of Conduct. The Employee agrees to conduct himself/herself in a manner that reflects positively on the reputation of the Employer and shall refrain from any conduct that may bring the Employer into disrepute. The Employer reserves the right to take disciplinary action, up to and including termination, for any breach of this provision.
5.3. Conflicting Obligations. While the Employee is required to report to the Director of Engineering for routine performance reviews, the Employee shall also directly liaise with the Chief Technology Officer regarding technical project oversight. In the event of conflicting instructions, the Employee must prioritize directives issued by the Director of Engineering, except where such instructions materially conflict with safety or compliance requirements, in which case the Employee must immediately consult with both superiors to resolve the conflict.

6. PERFORMANCE STANDARDS AND REVIEW
6.1. Employee Performance. The Employee agrees to perform his/her duties to the best of his/her abilities and in accordance with the standards set forth by the Employer. The Employer may set additional performance benchmarks as necessary.
6.2. Reviews. Performance reviews shall be conducted semi-annually, with the first review scheduled for August 15, 2024. Notwithstanding the semi-annual schedule, any significant deviation in performance expectations may trigger an additional review. In the event that a review is delayed or rescheduled for reasons beyond the control of either party, the Employer shall provide a written explanation to the Employee.
6.3. Adjustments. Based on performance reviews, the Employer may adjust the Employee’s base salary or bonus eligibility. Any changes made as a result of performance evaluations will become effective following a written amendment to this Agreement.

7. TERMINATION
7.1. At-Will Employment. The employment relationship is at-will. Either party may terminate this Agreement at any time, with or without cause, subject to the notice provisions herein.
7.2. Notice of Termination. The Employee or Employer must provide at least thirty (30) days’ written notice in the event of termination without cause. During the notice period, the Employee shall continue to perform his/her duties and assist in the transition process.
7.3. Termination for Cause. The Employer may immediately terminate this Agreement for cause if the Employee engages in gross misconduct, acts in a manner that is detrimental to the interests of the Employer, or breaches any material provision of this Agreement.
7.4. Post-Termination Obligations. Upon termination, the Employee shall immediately return all property belonging to the Employer, including but not limited to documents, equipment, and Confidential Information. In addition, the Employee shall cooperate with the Employer in any transition of responsibilities and provide reasonable assistance in transferring knowledge to other employees or third parties.

8. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY
8.1. Ownership. All Work Product conceived, developed, or reduced to practice by the Employee, either solely or in collaboration with others, during the course of employment shall be the exclusive property of the Employer. The Employee hereby irrevocably assigns and transfers to the Employer all rights, title, and interest in and to such Work Product.
8.2. Disclosure. The Employee agrees to promptly disclose to the Employer all Work Product, regardless of whether or not it is patentable or otherwise protectable by law. Further, the Employee shall provide all reasonable assistance to enable the Employer to perfect its rights under applicable intellectual property laws.

9. CONFIDENTIALITY AND NON-DISCLOSURE
9.1. Confidentiality. The Employee agrees to maintain in strict confidence and not to disclose any Confidential Information during or after the term of employment, except as may be necessary in carrying out his/her duties or as required by law.
9.2. Non-Disclosure. The Employee shall not, during the term of this Agreement or thereafter, use any Confidential Information for personal benefit or for the benefit of any third party, directly or indirectly. This obligation shall continue indefinitely, notwithstanding the termination of employment.
9.3. Remedies. The Employee acknowledges that any breach of this section may result in irreparable harm to the Employer, and in the event of such a breach, the Employer shall be entitled to seek injunctive relief in addition to any other remedies available under law.

10. ARBITRATION AND DISPUTE RESOLUTION
10.1. Informal Resolution. The parties agree to first attempt to resolve any disputes arising out of or relating to this Agreement through informal discussions.
10.2. Binding Arbitration. If a dispute cannot be resolved informally within thirty (30) days, the matter shall be submitted to binding arbitration in accordance with the rules of the American Arbitration Association. The arbitration shall be held in San Francisco, California, and the arbitrator’s decision shall be final and binding on both parties. (Note: This clause appears to conflict with the governing law set forth in Section 12.)

12. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION
