text:
SERVICE AGREEMENT

This SERVICE AGREEMENT (“Agreement”) is entered into by and between GlobalTech Solutions Inc., a corporation organized and existing under the laws of the State of New York, having its principal place of business at 1234 Innovation Drive, New York, NY 10001 (“Service Provider”), and Dynamic Enterprises LLC, a limited liability company organized under the laws of the State of New Jersey, with its principal place of business at 5678 Business Parkway, Newark, NJ 07102 (“Client”). Service Provider and Client are sometimes individually referred to as a “Party” and collectively as the “Parties.” This Agreement shall be effective as of January 1, 2024 (the “Effective Date”) and shall continue in full force and effect for a period of one (1) year, unless terminated earlier in accordance with the provisions herein ("Term").

RECITALS

WHEREAS, Service Provider possesses significant expertise and resources in delivering specialized information technology consulting, software development, and related business services; and

WHEREAS, Client desires to engage Service Provider to perform certain services as described herein, and Service Provider agrees to provide such services under the terms and conditions set forth herein;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants, representations, warranties, and agreements contained herein and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the Parties agree as follows:

1. DEFINITIONS

1.1 “Confidential Information” means any and all technical, business, financial, commercial, or other proprietary information disclosed by either Party to the other, either directly or indirectly, in writing, orally, electronically, or by any other means and which is designated as confidential or should reasonably be understood to be confidential under the circumstances. Confidential Information does not include information that (i) is or becomes publicly available without breach of any obligation; (ii) is received from a third party without breach of any obligation of confidentiality; or (iii) is independently developed by the receiving Party without use of or reference to the disclosing Party’s Confidential Information.

1.2 “Deliverables” means any reports, written documents, software, data, or other work product delivered by Service Provider to Client pursuant to the terms of this Agreement.

1.3 “Force Majeure Event” means any event or circumstance beyond the reasonable control of a Party that prevents or delays the performance of any part of this Agreement and includes, without limitation, acts of God, war, terrorism, labor disputes, governmental orders, epidemics, pandemics, or natural disasters.

1.4 “Services” means the tasks and obligations set forth in Section 2 (Scope of Services) of this Agreement, including but not limited to, consultation, software development, system integration, ongoing support, and maintenance.

1.5 “Statement of Work” or “SOW” means any work order agreed upon in writing by the Parties that outlines in greater detail the Services to be provided, including milestones, deliverables, schedules, and fees.

2. SCOPE OF SERVICES

2.1 Service Provider obligations. Service Provider shall provide the Services as set forth in the attached Exhibit A and any subsequent mutually agreed SOWs. The Services include, without limitation, comprehensive IT system analysis, development and testing of software applications, integration of third-party services, user training, maintenance, and support.

2.2 Service delivery. Service Provider agrees to deliver the Services diligently and professionally and in accordance with industry best practices. All Deliverables shall be prepared in a form acceptable to Client and delivered within the timelines specified in the applicable SOW or, if not specified, within a commercially reasonable time after the date of the request.

2.3 Modifications. The Parties acknowledge that the scope of Services may need adjustments over time. Any modification to the scope of Services or any SOW shall be documented in writing, executed by both Parties, and shall become an amendment to this Agreement.

3. TERM AND TERMINATION

3.1 Term. The initial term of this Agreement shall begin on the Effective Date and continue for one (1) year, after which it may be renewed upon mutual written agreement of the Parties. Unless renewed, this Agreement will automatically terminate at the end of the initial term unless terminated earlier in accordance with Section 3.2.

3.2 Termination for Convenience. Either Party may terminate this Agreement, in whole or in part, for any reason by providing the other Party with at least thirty (30) days' prior written notice. In the event of such termination, Service Provider shall be entitled to compensation for all Services satisfactorily performed prior to the effective date of termination.

3.3 Termination for Cause. Either Party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice if the other Party materially breaches any obligation herein and fails to cure such breach within fifteen (15) days after receiving written notice thereof. In the event of termination for cause by Client, Client’s sole and exclusive remedy shall be the immediate cessation of Services and recovery of any prepaid fees not applicable to Services rendered.

3.4 Effect of Termination. Upon termination or expiration of this Agreement, (i) all outstanding fees and charges accrued up to the termination date shall become immediately due and payable; (ii) Service Provider shall deliver to Client all completed Deliverables and any work in progress; (iii) each Party shall return or destroy, at the other Party’s option, all Confidential Information; and (iv) the rights and obligations of the Parties that by their nature are intended to survive termination shall remain in effect, including but not limited to, the provisions concerning confidentiality, indemnification, limitation of liability, and dispute resolution.

4. PAYMENT AND FEES

4.1 Fees. In consideration for the performance of Services, Client shall compensate Service Provider as described in the applicable SOW or Exhibit A attached hereto. All fees are stated in United States dollars (USD).

4.2 Invoicing and Payment Terms. Service Provider shall invoice Client monthly in arrears for Services rendered. Each invoice shall provide sufficient detail regarding the Services performed and such corresponding fees. Client agrees to pay all undisputed fees within thirty (30) days of receipt of the invoice. In the event Client disputes any portion of an invoice, Client shall notify Service Provider in writing within fifteen (15) days of receipt; the disputed amount shall not be due until the dispute is resolved, but all undisputed amounts shall remain payable in accordance with this Section.

4.3 Taxes. All fees are exclusive of any applicable taxes, levies, or duties imposed by taxing authorities, and Client shall be responsible for paying any such taxes, except for taxes based on Service Provider’s net income.

4.4 Late Payment. Any amounts not paid within the stipulated time shall accrue interest at a rate of 1.5% per month or the highest rate allowed by law, whichever is lower, until paid in full.

5. OBLIGATIONS OF THE PARTIES

5.1 Service Provider’s Representations and Warranties. Service Provider represents and warrants that (i) it has the authority to enter into this Agreement; (ii) it shall perform the Services in a professional, workmanlike manner in accordance with generally accepted industry standards; (iii) all Deliverables shall substantially conform to the specifications set forth in the applicable SOW; and (iv) its performance will not infringe upon or violate any third-party intellectual property rights.

5.2 Client’s Representations and Warranties. Client represents and warrants that (i) it is duly organized, validly existing, and in good standing under the laws of its jurisdiction of formation; (ii) it has the full power and authority to enter into this Agreement; (iii) it shall provide accurate and complete information necessary for Service Provider to perform the Services; and (iv) it shall provide timely access to any equipment, systems, or facilities necessary for Service Provider’s performance of the Services.

5.3 Cooperation. Client agrees to cooperate with Service Provider, including providing timely access to relevant personnel, systems, data, and other information necessary for the performance of the Services. Delays or omissions in providing such access or information may result in delays to the agreed-upon deadlines or additional charges.

5.4 Independent Contractors. The Parties acknowledge that Service Provider is engaged as an independent contractor, and nothing contained in this Agreement shall be construed to create a partnership, joint venture, employer-employee, or agency relationship between Client and Service Provider. Neither Party shall have authority to bind the other.

6. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS

6.1 Ownership of Pre-Existing Materials. Each Party shall retain all right, title, and interest in and to its respective pre-existing intellectual property, including any trade secrets, patents, copyrights, or trademarks owned or licensed before the Effective Date.

6.2 Ownership of Deliverables. Subject to Client’s payment obligations herein, all right, title, and interest in the Deliverables produced under this Agreement shall be deemed “work made for hire” and fully assigned to Client upon full and final payment. To the extent such Deliverables do not qualify as “work made for hire,” Service Provider hereby assigns all right, title, and interest in and to such Deliverables to Client, free and clear of any liens or encumbrances.

6.3 License to Service Provider Tools. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Service Provider reserves the right to use general skills, knowledge, and experience, including ideas, concepts, know-how, and techniques, which may be developed or acquired in the course of performing the Services. This reservation does not include the transfer of any proprietary Client data or confidential information.

7. CONFIDENTIALITY

7.1 Duty of Confidentiality. Each Party agrees that it will not disclose, directly or indirectly, any Confidential Information of the other Party to any third party without the prior written consent of the disclosing Party, except as required by law or as necessary to its employees or agents who are bound by confidentiality obligations no less restrictive than those contained herein.

7.2 Use Limitation. Confidential Information shall be used solely for the purposes of performing under this Agreement and shall not be used for any other purpose.

7.3 Required Disclosures. In the event a Party is required by applicable law, regulation, or court order to disclose any Confidential Information, such Party shall provide the other Party with prompt written notice prior to any such disclosure so that the other Party may seek appropriate protective measures.

7.4 Duration. The obligations of confidentiality set forth in this Section shall remain in effect during the Term and for a period of three (3) years following the termination or expiration of this Agreement.

8. DATA PROTECTION AND SECURITY

8.1 Data Security. Service Provider agrees to implement and maintain reasonable administrative, physical, and technical safeguards to protect Client’s data from unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction. The safeguards shall conform to industry standards and comply with any applicable data protection laws.

8.2 Data Breach Notification. In the event of any unauthorized access or breach of Client data, Service Provider shall promptly notify Client, no later than 48 hours after becoming aware of the breach, and shall cooperate with Client in investigating and mitigating the effects of such breach.

8.3 Data Ownership. Client shall retain all rights and ownership in and to its data provided to or generated by Service Provider in connection with the performance of the Services.

9. WARRANTIES AND DISCLAIMERS

9.1 Mutual Warranties. Each Party warrants that it has the power and authority to enter into this Agreement and that the execution, delivery, and performance of the Agreement do not conflict with or result in any breach of any other agreement by which it may be bound.

9.2 Service Provider Warranties. Service Provider further warrants that the Services and Deliverables shall conform substantially to the standards set forth in this Agreement and any applicable SOW. In the event of any non-conformance, Service Provider shall, at its sole discretion, either re-perform the Services or correct the Deliverables at no additional charge to Client.

LEASE AGREEMENT

THIS LEASE AGREEMENT (“Agreement”) is entered into as of the 1st day of July, 2023 (“Effective Date”), by and between John A. Landlord (“Landlord”), whose address for the purpose of this Agreement is 1234 Main Street, Cityville, State 12345, and Jane B. Tenant (“Tenant”), whose current mailing address is 5678 Oak Avenue, Townsville, State 67890. Landlord and Tenant are sometimes individually referred to as a “Party” and collectively as the “Parties.”

RECITALS
WHEREAS, Landlord is the owner of the residential property located at 7890 Pine Road, Apt 5B, Cityville, State 12345 (the “Premises”); and
WHEREAS, Tenant desires to lease the Premises from Landlord for residential purposes only, and Landlord is willing to lease the Premises to Tenant on the terms and conditions set forth herein;
NOW, THEREFORE, for and in consideration of the mutual covenants contained herein and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the Parties agree as follows:

1. DEFINITIONS
1.1 “Lease Term” means the period during which Tenant shall have the right to occupy the Premises, as set forth in Section 2.
1.2 “Rent” shall mean the monthly rental amount payable by Tenant to Landlord in accordance with Section 3.
1.3 “Security Deposit” refers to the deposit payable by Tenant to Landlord as set forth in Section 4.
1.4 “Common Areas” means those portions of any building or improvements either managed, maintained or controlled by Landlord that are available for the use of Tenant and other occupants.
1.5 “Breach” means any failure by either Party to perform as required under this Agreement.
1.6 “Force Majeure Event” includes any act, event, accident, or omission beyond the reasonable control of a Party that prevents or delays the performance of any obligations under this Agreement.

2. TERM
2.1 Lease Term. The term of this Agreement shall commence on July 1, 2023 (“Commencement Date”) and expire on June 30, 2024 (“Expiration Date”), unless terminated sooner pursuant to the provisions herein.
2.2 Renewal Option. Provided that Tenant is not in Breach of any provision of this Agreement, Tenant may request a renewal by giving Landlord written notice at least sixty (60) days prior to the Expiration Date. Renewal shall be subject to a new agreed-upon rental rate and any lawful changes in terms set forth mutually by the Parties.
2.3 Possession. Tenant shall be entitled to possession of the Premises on the Commencement Date and shall vacate by the Expiration Date or any extended termination date agreed upon by the Parties in writing.

3. RENT
3.1 Amount. Tenant agrees to pay Landlord a monthly Rent of One Thousand Two Hundred Dollars ($1,200.00), payable on or before the 1st day of each month.
3.2 Payment Method. Rent shall be paid by check, money order, or any other method approved by Landlord in writing. All payments shall be made to Landlord at the address specified herein or at such other designated location as Landlord may reasonably designate.
3.3 Late Fees. Any Rent payment not received by Landlord within five (5) days after its due date shall incur a late fee equal to 5% of the overdue amount. If the Rent remains unpaid for more than fifteen (15) days after the due date, Landlord may, at its sole discretion, charge an additional fee or consider the Tenant to be in default, as provided herein in Section 10.
3.4 No Set-Off. Tenant waives any right to set-off or counter any claims against Rent payments and agrees that nonpayment or delay in payment constitutes a material Breach of this Agreement.

4. SECURITY DEPOSIT
4.1 Deposit Amount. Upon execution of this Agreement, Tenant shall deposit with Landlord the sum of One Thousand Two Hundred Dollars ($1,200.00) as a Security Deposit.
4.2 Use of Deposit. The Security Deposit may be used by Landlord to remedy any Breach of this Agreement, including but not limited to unpaid Rent, damage to the Premises, or the cost of cleaning beyond normal wear and tear.
4.3 Return of Deposit. Within thirty (30) days after Tenant vacates the Premises, subject to any lawful deductions for damages or unpaid Rent as allowed by applicable law, Landlord shall return the Security Deposit. The return of the Security Deposit shall be in itemized written form with details of any deductions, if applicable.
4.4 Non-Waiver. Waiver of any rights related to the Security Deposit shall not affect any other rights or obligations of either Party under this Agreement.

5. USE OF PREMISES
5.1 Permitted Use. The Premises shall be used solely as a private residence by Tenant and the immediate family of Tenant, and for no other purpose without the prior written consent of Landlord.
5.2 Compliance With Law. Tenant agrees to comply with all governmental and municipal laws, ordinances, and regulations affecting the use of the Premises.
5.3 Prohibited Activities. Tenant shall not engage in any illegal or dangerous activities on the Premises, including but not limited to any activity that may jeopardize the health and safety of neighbors, compromise the structure of the Premises, or lead to administrative fines or criminal sanctions.
5.4 Subletting. Tenant shall not sublet the Premises or any part thereof without the prior written consent of Landlord, which consent shall be granted or denied in Landlord’s sole discretion. Approved subletting arrangements shall be memorialized in writing and signed by both Parties.

6. CONDITION AND MAINTENANCE OF PREMISES
6.1 Tenant’s Acknowledgment. Tenant acknowledges that they have inspected the Premises prior to executing this Agreement and accepts the Premises in “as is” condition, subject to Landlord’s obligation for maintenance as set forth herein.
6.2 Landlord’s Obligations. Landlord shall maintain the structural integrity of the Premises and ensure that all major systems (plumbing, electrical, heating, and cooling) are in working condition at the time of delivery and maintain them in a reasonably functional condition during the Lease Term.
6.3 Tenant’s Responsibilities. Tenant shall maintain the Premises in a neat, clean, and sanitary condition, immediate repairs for any minor damage, and notify Landlord promptly of any repair or maintenance needs. Tenant shall not make any alterations, improvements, or additions to the Premises without Landlord’s prior written consent.
6.4 Routine Repairs. Tenant shall be responsible for minor repairs and maintenance arising out of everyday use, such as replacement of light bulbs, batteries in smoke detectors, cleaning filters, and general housekeeping. In the event the repair is necessary due to Tenant misuse or negligence, Landlord may charge Tenant for the incurred costs.
6.5 Emergencies. In the event of an emergency, Tenant is authorized to take all reasonable steps to protect life and property, and shall notify Landlord as soon as possible thereafter.

7. UTILITIES AND SERVICES
7.1 Tenant’s Utilities. Tenant shall be responsible for arranging and paying for all utilities and services necessary for the use of the Premises, including but not limited to electricity, gas, water, sewage, garbage, internet, and cable television.
7.2 Landlord’s Utilities. Landlord shall be responsible for maintaining any services that are exclusively provided by the Landlord for common areas, exterior lighting, and property security systems.
7.3 Interruption of Services. Landlord shall not be liable for any interruption or failure of any utilities beyond Landlord’s control. Tenant shall promptly notify Landlord if such interruption affects the food safety, health, or security of the Premises.

8. INSURANCE
8.1 Tenant’s Insurance. It is strongly recommended, and Tenant hereby agrees, to obtain renter’s insurance covering personal property and liability arising out of Tenant’s occupancy. Tenant shall maintain such insurance during the Lease Term.
8.2 Landlord’s Insurance. Landlord shall maintain insurance on the Premises covering property damage and liability as applicable, but shall have no obligation to cover or reimburse any loss or damage to Tenant’s personal property.
8.3 Waiver and Hold Harmless. Tenant agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Landlord from any and all claims, losses, liabilities, or expenses, including attorney’s fees, arising out of or related to Tenant’s failure to secure insurance or any claims for personal property not insured.

9. ALTERATIONS AND IMPROVEMENTS
9.1 Alterations. Tenant shall not, without Landlord’s prior written approval, make any alterations, improvements, or additions to the Premises which, in Landlord’s reasonable judgment, would affect the physical integrity or structural soundness thereof.
9.2 Ownership of Improvements. Any alterations or improvements made by Tenant with Landlord’s consent shall become the property of Landlord upon termination of this Agreement, except when the Parties agree otherwise in writing.
9.3 Restoration. Upon expiration or earlier termination of this Agreement, Tenant shall, at Landlord’s election, remove any alterations and restore the Premises to its original condition, reasonable wear and tear excepted.

10. DEFAULT AND REMEDIES
10.1 Events of Default. The following events shall constitute a default by Tenant:
  (a) Failure to pay Rent when due;
  (b) Violation of any material provision of Sections 5, 6, or 7;
  (c) Unauthorized subletting or assignment as described in Section 5.4;
  (d) Failure to maintain the Premises as required herein;
  (e) Abandonment of the Premises.
10.2 Notice of Default. Should Tenant be in default, Landlord shall provide written notice specifying the nature of the default. Tenant shall have ten (10) days from the date of receipt of such notice to cure the default, except in the case of non-payment of Rent where the cure period shall be five (5) days.
10.3 Remedies. If the default is not cured within the stipulated period, Landlord may, at its option:
  (a) Terminate this Agreement upon providing additional written notice;
  (b) Seek appropriate legal and equitable remedies, including eviction and recovery of damages, attorney’s fees, and costs;
  (c) Apply any unpaid Rent or charges to cure the default, as permitted by law.
10.4 No Waiver. Landlord’s failure to enforce any provision of this Agreement shall in no way be construed as a waiver of any rights under this Agreement or applicable law.

11. ASSIGNMENT AND SUBLETTING
11.1 Assignment. Tenant shall not assign, transfer, or encumber any interest in this Agreement without Landlord’s prior written consent, which shall not be unreasonably withheld.
11.2 Subletting. Any subletting requires the written consent of Landlord in accordance with Section 5.4. Any attempt to assign or sublet in violation of this provision shall be void and shall, at Landlord’s option, constitute a default under Section 10.
11.3 Successors and Assigns. This Agreement shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the Parties and their respective successors, heirs, and permitted assigns.

12. DISPUTE RESOLUTION
12.1 Informal Resolution. In the event of any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement (a “Dispute”), the Parties agree to promptly negotiate in good faith to amicably resolve such Dispute.
12.2 Mediation. If the Dispute cannot be resolved through good-faith negotiation within fifteen (15) days, the Parties agree to submit the matter to mediation conducted by a mutually agreed-upon neutral mediator in Cityville, State. The mediation shall be conducted pursuant to commercially reasonable procedures.
12.3 Arbitration. In the event that mediation fails to resolve the Dispute within thirty (30) days, the prevailing Party may demand arbitration. All Disputes by either Party shall be finally settled by binding arbitration in accordance with the rules of the American Arbitration Association. Judgment upon the arbitrator’s award may be entered in any court of competent jurisdiction.
12.4 Costs. Each Party shall bear its own costs in connection with mediation or arbitration. The arbitrator or mediator may apportion the costs of mediation or arbitration between the Parties as deemed fair and reasonable.
12.5 Continued Performance. During the pendency of any Dispute resolution process, the Parties shall continue to perform all obligations under this Agreement, except for any obligation

This Rental Agreement ("Agreement") is executed as of the 1st day of May, 2023 (the "Effective Date") by and between Landlord: John Q. Landowner of 123 Main Street, Capital City, State A (hereinafter "Landlord") and Tenant: Jane R. Tenant of 456 Elm Street, Suburbia, State B (hereinafter "Tenant").

RECITALS
WHEREAS, Landlord is the lawful owner of the residential premises located at 789 Oak Avenue, Hometown, State A (the "Premises"); and
WHEREAS, Tenant desires to lease said Premises from Landlord on the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement; 
NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and promises contained herein, the parties agree as follows:

1. DEFINITIONS
   1.1. "Premises" shall mean the dwelling unit located at 789 Oak Avenue, Hometown, State A, including any designated common areas, storage space, and parking facilities, unless otherwise defined herein.
   1.2. "Lease Term" refers to the period for which this Agreement remains in effect, commencing on June 1, 2023 and terminating on May 31, 2024, unless terminated sooner pursuant to Section 10.
   1.3. "Monthly Rent" means the rental fee payable at the rate established under Section 3 herein.
   1.4. "Maintenance Services" refers to the services necessary to preserve the functionality, safety, and appearance of the Premises, as elaborated in Section 7.

2. TERM OF LEASE
   The Lease Term shall commence on June 1, 2023 and conclude on May 31, 2024. Notwithstanding the foregoing, certain obligations may extend beyond the Term as described in Section 12 (Dispute Resolution and Post-Term Obligations). Tenant shall be entitled to occupancy of the Premises beginning on the commencement date. Early termination provisions, if exercised by Tenant pursuant to Section 10, shall similarly adjust the Lease Term accordingly.

3. RENTAL AMOUNT AND PAYMENT
   3.1. Tenant agrees to pay a monthly rent in the amount of One Thousand Two Hundred Dollars ($1,200.00) payable in accordance with the Payment Schedule outlined herein.
   3.2. Payment Schedule:
       a) The first monthly rent payment of $1,200.00 is due on or before July 1, 2023.
       b) Subsequent payments of $1,200.00 shall be due on the 1st of each month.
       c) In the event that the 1st day of any month falls on a weekend or public holiday, the payment is due on the next business day.
   3.3. Notwithstanding Section 3.1, the parties herein acknowledge that an earlier draft of this Agreement specified a Monthly Rent of One Thousand Three Hundred Dollars ($1,300.00), and such figure may be referenced in any notices delivered prior to May 15, 2023. All payments subsequent to this revision shall be made at the amount specified in Section 3.1.

4. SECURITY DEPOSIT
   4.1. Tenant shall deposit with Landlord the sum of One Thousand Two Hundred Dollars ($1,200.00) as a security deposit (the "Security Deposit") on or before the commencement of occupancy. The Security Deposit shall secure Tenant’s performance of all terms of this Agreement.
   4.2. The Security Deposit, or any balance thereof, shall be returned within thirty (30) days after the end of the Lease Term, subject to deductions for damages, unpaid rent, or any other charges due under this Agreement.

5. USE OF PREMISES
   5.1. The Premises shall be used exclusively for residential purposes by no more than four (4) occupants, except as may be agreed to in writing by Landlord.
   5.2. Tenant shall not permit any commercial activities on the Premises, nor shall Tenant engage in any unlawful activities that could jeopardize the safety, security, or welfare of the occupants or neighbors.
   5.3. Tenant agrees to abide by any and all governing community rules and regulations, and failure to comply may constitute grounds for termination of this Agreement.

6. UTILITIES AND SERVICES
   6.1. Landlord shall provide for and maintain the following utilities: water, sewer, and garbage collection. Electricity, gas, cable television, internet, and other utilities shall be the sole responsibility of Tenant.
   6.2. Tenant shall promptly pay all utility bills, and failure to do so shall constitute a breach of this Agreement, entitling Landlord to exercise any remedies available by law.

7. MAINTENANCE AND REPAIRS
   7.1. General Maintenance:
         a) Tenant agrees to maintain the interior of the Premises in a neat and sanitary condition and to immediately notify Landlord of any necessary repairs.
         b) Minor repairs costing less than One Hundred Dollars ($100.00) shall be performed by Tenant at Tenant’s expense.
   7.2. Major Repairs and Services:
         a) Landlord shall be responsible for major repairs, including but not limited to structural repairs, roof repair, and major plumbing or electrical work.
         b) In Section 7.1.a, Tenant is also tasked with performing routine maintenance of the garden area and exterior appearance. However, Landlord may, at its discretion, assume such responsibilities if Tenant's maintenance is deemed inadequate.
         c) Notwithstanding Section 7.2.b, a separate agreement dated April 15, 2023, stated that Tenant shall bear responsibility for all exterior repairs and prophylactic maintenance of the building envelope. In case of any conflict, the terms of this Agreement shall govern.

8. ALTERATIONS AND IMPROVEMENTS
   8.1. Tenant shall not make any alterations, decorations, additions, or improvements to the Premises without the prior written consent of Landlord.
   8.2. Any alterations approved by Landlord shall become the property of Landlord upon termination of the Lease Term, unless otherwise agreed in writing.

9. INSURANCE
   9.1. Tenant is strongly advised to obtain renter’s insurance for personal property. Tenant’s insurance shall not be deemed a substitute for Landlord’s property insurance.
   9.2. Landlord’s insurance shall provide coverage for the building and any structural components of the Premises.

10. EARLY TERMINATION
   10.1. Either party may terminate this Agreement by providing written notice at least sixty (60) days in advance of the desired termination date.
   10.2. In the event Tenant terminates this Agreement before the end of the Lease Term without proper notice or cause, Tenant shall be liable for an early termination fee equal to two (2) months’ rent, as specified under Section 3.
   10.3. Notwithstanding Section 10.2, if Tenant terminates the lease effective on April 1, 2024, the early termination fee shall be waived provided Tenant furnishes a replacement tenant acceptable to Landlord. All notices regarding termination must be delivered by certified mail.

11. SUBLETTING AND ASSIGNMENT
   11.1. Tenant shall not sublet the Premises or assign this Agreement, in whole or in part, without the prior written consent of Landlord, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld.
   11.2. Any approved subletting or assignment shall be subject to the same terms and conditions as set forth herein.

12. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION
   12.1. This Agreement and all disputes arising hereunder shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of State A.
   12.2. Notwithstanding Section 12.1, any litigation related to minor breaches of this Agreement, including but not limited to late rental payments and routine maintenance disputes, shall be resolved under the laws and jurisdiction of State B. The parties acknowledge that the choice of jurisdiction provided herein is binding, and any change thereof shall require the written consent of both parties.

13. DEFAULT AND REMEDIES
   13.1. If Tenant fails to pay rent or breaches any other material term of this Agreement, Landlord shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon providing Tenant with a written notice of default. Tenant shall have five (5) days to remedy such default after receipt of notice.
   13.2. If Tenant fails to cure the default within the specified time period, Landlord may pursue all available remedies at law or in equity, including immediate eviction and termination of this Agreement.

14. NOTICE AND COMMUNICATION
   14.1. Any notice required or permitted to be given hereunder shall be in writing and deemed to have been duly given if delivered personally or sent by certified mail or email to the addresses specified in the opening paragraph, or to such other address as either party may designate in writing.
   14.2. Notices shall be deemed received within three (3) business days of posting if mailed or upon confirmation of delivery if emailed.

15. MISCELLANEOUS
   15.1. Entire Agreement: This Agreement constitutes the entire understanding between the parties with respect to the subject matter herein and supersedes all prior discussions, agreements, or representations, either oral or written.
   15.2. Amendments: Any amendment or modification to this Agreement must be in writing and duly executed by both parties.
   15.3. Severability: If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall continue in full force and effect.
   15.4. Waiver: No waiver of any breach or default shall be deemed a waiver of any subsequent breach.
   15.5. Counterparts: This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one instrument.

16. SPECIAL PROVISIONS
   16.1. The parties agree that any dispute regarding conflicting obligations, including but not limited to those set forth in Sections 7 (Maintenance and Repairs) and 10 (Early Termination), shall be resolved through binding arbitration conducted in a neutral venue mutually agreed upon by the parties.
   16.2. Tenant acknowledges receipt of a written copy of the Community Rules which supplement this Agreement and agrees to comply with such rules at all times during the Lease Term.
   16.3. Notwithstanding all other provisions of this Agreement, it is explicitly acknowledged by both parties that the definitions provided in Section 1 may differ from the usage in certain sections herein, and such discrepancies are to be resolved as follows: in the event of any ambiguity, the usage which best reflects the current practice of either party as of the Effective Date shall prevail.

17. DISPUTE RESOLUTION
   17.1. In the event of any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, the parties agree to first attempt to resolve the matter through mediation. If mediation fails to resolve the dispute within thirty (30) days after initiation, the dispute shall be submitted to binding arbitration in accordance with the rules of the American Arbitration Association.
   17.2. Notwithstanding the arbitration clause in Section 17.1, disputes relating to contractual interpretations of rental payment schedules or revision of payment amounts shall be litigated in the small claims court of the county in which the Premises is located.

18. EXECUTION
   18.1. This Agreement is executed in two counterparts, both of which are deemed originals and together constitute one instrument.
   18.2. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have executed this Rental Agreement as of the dates set forth below.

Landlord:

John Q. Landowner

text:
PURCHASE AGREEMENT

This Purchase Agreement (“Agreement”) is made and entered into as of July 1, 2023 (“Effective Date”), by and between Global Trade Enterprises, Inc., a Delaware corporation with its principal place of business at 1234 Market Street, Wilmington, DE 19801 (“Seller”), and Horizon Investments LLC, a New York limited liability company with its principal place of business at 5678 Broadway, New York, NY 10012 (“Buyer”). Seller and Buyer are sometimes individually referred to herein as a “Party” and collectively as the “Parties.”

WHEREAS, Seller owns and is engaged in the business of manufacturing and selling industrial machinery and related equipment; and

WHEREAS, Buyer desires to purchase from Seller certain industrial machinery and equipment as described herein, and Seller is willing to sell such machinery and equipment on the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the premises, the mutual covenants and agreements contained herein, and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the Parties agree as follows:

1. DEFINITIONS
   1.1 “Products” shall mean the industrial machinery and equipment described in Exhibit A attached hereto and incorporated herein by reference.
   1.2 “Purchase Price” shall mean the total amount to be paid by Buyer to Seller for the Products as set forth in Section 3 herein.
   1.3 “Delivery Date” shall mean the date on which the Products are to be delivered to Buyer’s designated location as set forth in Section 4 herein.
   1.4 “Confidential Information” means all information disclosed by one Party to the other, either directly or indirectly, in writing, orally or by inspection of tangible objects, that is designated as confidential or that reasonably should be understood to be confidential.
   1.5 “Force Majeure” shall have the meaning assigned in Section 15 hereof.

2. PURCHASE AND SALE
   2.1 Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Seller agrees to sell, and Buyer agrees to purchase, the Products on a “FOB Seller’s Facility” basis as more fully specified in Section 4.
   2.2 The sale of the Products by Seller to Buyer is made on a firm commitment basis and is not contingent upon any future event or condition except as provided in this Agreement.

3. PURCHASE PRICE AND PAYMENT TERMS
   3.1 The Purchase Price for the Products is One Million Five Hundred Thousand U.S. Dollars (US$1,500,000), which shall include all applicable taxes, fees, and charges unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Parties.
   3.2 Payment Schedule: 
       (a) An initial deposit equal to 30% of the Purchase Price (US$450,000) shall be paid by Buyer to Seller within five (5) business days after the Effective Date.
       (b) A second payment equal to 40% of the Purchase Price (US$600,000) shall be paid upon Seller’s completion of production and confirmation of readiness for shipment, but no later than August 15, 2023.
       (c) The remaining balance of 30% (US$450,000) shall be paid upon delivery of the Products as specified in Section 4.
   3.3 All payments made under this Agreement shall be in U.S. dollars and transferred by wire transfer or other mutually agreed method to the designated account of Seller as indicated in writing.
   3.4 Late Payment. If Buyer fails to make any payment when due, interest shall accrue on the overdue amount at a rate of 1.5% per month, or the maximum rate permitted by law, whichever is lower, until payment is received.

4. DELIVERY AND TITLE TRANSFER
   4.1 Delivery Terms: Delivery of the Products shall be made on an FOB (Free on Board) basis from Seller’s facility located at 1234 Market Street, Wilmington, DE 19801. Seller shall be responsible for ensuring that the Products are safely loaded onto Buyer’s designated carrier.
   4.2 Risk of Loss. Risk of loss shall pass from Seller to Buyer at the time the Products are loaded onto the carrier at Seller’s facility.
   4.3 Estimated Delivery Date. The Products shall be delivered on or before August 31, 2023, unless delayed by circumstances beyond the control of Seller, in which case Seller shall notify Buyer in writing of the revised Delivery Date.
   4.4 Inspection. Buyer shall have a period of seven (7) business days following the Delivery Date to inspect the Products. Any claims for shortage or damage must be made in writing within this inspection period. Failure to notify Seller within this period shall constitute a waiver of any claims related to condition upon delivery.

5. WARRANTIES
   5.1 Seller’s Warranty. Seller warrants that the Products delivered under this Agreement shall:
       (a) Be new and free from defects in material and workmanship,
       (b) Conform in all material respects to the specifications set forth in Exhibit A,
       (c) Be fit for the purpose for which such Products are ordinarily used.
   5.2 Warranty Period. The warranty period shall commence on the Delivery Date and shall last for twelve (12) months from such date.
   5.3 Exclusions. This warranty does not apply to defects or damages resulting from misuse, improper installation, unauthorized modification, or acts of negligence by Buyer or third parties.
   5.4 Remedy. In the event of any breach of the foregoing warranty, Seller’s sole obligation and Buyer’s exclusive remedy shall be the repair or replacement of the defective Product, at Seller’s option, or a refund of the Purchase Price for the affected Products.

6. INSPECTION, ACCEPTANCE, AND REJECTION
   6.1 Inspection. Buyer shall have the right to inspect the Products immediately upon delivery. 
   6.2 Acceptance. Acceptance of the Products shall be deemed to have occurred upon either (i) Buyer’s failure to notify Seller of any defects or shortages within seven (7) business days following the Delivery Date, or (ii) Buyer’s execution of the certificate of acceptance as set forth in Exhibit B.
   6.3 Rejection. If any Products do not conform to the specifications or are otherwise defective, Buyer must notify Seller in writing within the aforementioned inspection period. Seller shall, at its sole discretion, repair, replace, or refund the Purchase Price for such non-conforming Products. Any such remedy shall be the sole and exclusive remedy for any breach of warranty.

7. TITLE AND RISK
   7.1 Title. Title to the Products shall pass from Seller to Buyer upon full payment of the Purchase Price and successful transfer of the Products per Section 4.
   7.2 Risk of Loss. Notwithstanding the transfer of title, risk of loss shall be governed by Section 4.2 in accordance with the FOB shipment terms.

8. REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES
   8.1 Each Party represents and warrants that:
       (a) It is duly organized, validly existing, and in good standing under the laws of its jurisdiction of incorporation or formation;
       (b) It has all requisite corporate or other power and authority to execute, deliver, and perform its obligations under this Agreement;
       (c) The execution, delivery, and performance of this Agreement have been duly authorized by all necessary action on its part.
   8.2 Seller further represents that the Products are free from any liens, claims, or encumbrances.
   8.3 Buyer represents that it has conducted its own due diligence regarding the suitability of the Products, and its execution of this Agreement does not violate any other agreement or obligation to which it is bound.

9. COVENANTS OF THE PARTIES
   9.1 Seller’s Covenants. Seller hereby covenants that it shall:
       (a) Manufacture and deliver the Products in accordance with the specifications and timeline set forth herein;
       (b) Provide all necessary documents, manuals, and instructions required for the proper use and maintenance of the Products;
       (c) Assist Buyer in coordinating the shipment and delivery of the Products.
   9.2 Buyer’s Covenants. Buyer hereby covenants that it shall:
       (a) Make payments in accordance with Section 3;
       (b) Provide Seller with prompt written notice of any issues or defects arising during the inspection period set forth in Section 6;
       (c) Comply with all instructions and guidelines provided by Seller relating to the installation, use, and maintenance of the Products.

10. CONFIDENTIALITY AND NON-DISCLOSURE
   10.1 Confidentiality. Each Party agrees that all Confidential Information received from the other during the term of this Agreement will be maintained in strict confidence and shall not be disclosed to any third party except as required by law or with the express written consent of the disclosing Party.
   10.2 Duration. The obligations of confidentiality set forth in this Section 10 shall survive termination or expiration of this Agreement for a period of five (5) years.

11. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS
   11.1 Seller’s Intellectual Property. Seller retains all right, title, and interest in and to any intellectual property underlying the design, manufacturing processes, or operation of the Products. Buyer shall have no rights under this Agreement to any of Seller’s intellectual property.
   11.2 License. Insofar as necessary for the installation and operation of the Products in accordance with Seller’s instructions, Seller hereby grants Buyer a non-exclusive, non-transferable license to use Seller’s trade secrets and other intellectual property solely for its internal use.
   11.3 Restrictions. Buyer shall not use, modify, or reverse engineer any of Seller’s intellectual property except as expressly permitted in this Agreement.

12. INDEMNIFICATION
   12.1 Seller’s Indemnification. Seller shall defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Buyer, its affiliates, and their respective officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, losses, liabilities, expenses (including reasonable attorneys’ fees), or damages arising out of or relating to:
       (a) Any breach by Seller of its representations, warranties, or covenants herein,
       (b) Any defect in the Products caused by Seller’s manufacturing process.
   12.2 Buyer’s Indemnification. Buyer shall defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Seller, its affiliates, and their respective officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, losses, liabilities, expenses (including reasonable attorneys’ fees), or damages arising out of or relating to:
       (a) Buyer’s use, installation, or operation of the Products in a manner not in accordance with Seller’s instructions,
       (b) Any breach by Buyer of its representations, warranties, or covenants herein.
   12.3 Indemnification Procedures. The indemnified Party shall promptly notify the indemnifying Party in writing of any claim for which indemnification is sought. The indemnifying Party shall have sole control of the defense and settlement of such claim, provided that no settlement shall be made that imposes any liability or obligation on the indemnified Party without its prior written consent.

13. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY
   13.1 Neither Party shall be liable to the other for any consequential, incidental, or special damages arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, whether in contract, tort, or otherwise, even if advised of the possibility of such damages.
   13.2 In no event shall either Party’s total liability exceed the Purchase Price paid or payable under this Agreement.

14. TERMINATION
